text: An upstate New York town. A CIRCUS is being dismantled... Big Top falls and is gathered up by workmen...Trucks are being loaded with animals.

AN ELDERLY MAN , JACOB JANKOWSKI - 93 year old - stands alone, with a walker in the middle of the empty parking l His shirt is stained with sweat - as if it took great eff for him to get there. As he watches the Circus disappear, Jacob looks lost, bewildered and fragile. CHARLIE, 50's circus manager, and RUSS, a tattooed teen w rings through his eyebrows, approach him with a wheelchai
Excuse me sir, can we help you? (No reply from Jacob) Did you miss your ride?
I missed the Spec.
The what?
Yes, I'm afraid you did. Can we call someone for you?
Where'd it all go?
He's seriously old.
Did you come with the folks from the retirement home?
No, I came on my own.
Let's go inside and we can call them to pick you up. Charlie motions for Russ to get Jacob in the wheelchair. Jacob resists. 2.
No, I told ya, I came on my own and I'm not going back. Get your hands off me.
(as if talking to a child) It's OK. We're gonna call the home so they can come pick you up.
Why don't you pick some of those rings out ya head maybe you won't be so stupid, ya dumb little shit.
Woah! The language. Uncalled for.
Sir, we need to get you out of this parking lot. My trucks have to come through here. Please... He offers the wheelchair. Jacob relents and sits.
I got it Russ. Take the walker. Finish closing up the ticket booth. Russ takes the walker and exits as Charlie wheels Jacob.
In my day, they had old timers in the ticket wicket and freaks like him in the sideshow. Damn kid didn't even know what the Spec was.
You sound like you know circuses. Charlie checks his watch, impatient to get Jacob home.
I should. I was on two.
(Calling OS to Trucks) Malcolm, tell them to come through! (Patronizing, to Jacob) Two circuses. Wow, that's something. 3.
Ringling, of course, but that was later...
I'll need your name when I call the home.
...First one was called Benzini Brothers Most Spectacular Show ... Charlie suddenly stops upon hearing that name.
What?...Wait a minute! Did you say you were with the Benzini Brothers?
What years?
" 31?...You're saying you were there for the---?
I was in the middle of it.
I don't believe this. After the Hartford Fire and the Hagenback- Wallace Wreck, that's the most famous circus disaster of all time.
I remember it like yesterday... Better - cause I don't remember yesterday.
Charlie O'Brien the third.
Jacob Jankowski the only.
Mr. Jankowski, I would be honored if you would have a drink with me in my trailer. 4.
A bottle of expensive, Laphroaig scotch sits on the table Charlie pours them each a shot. Jacobs drinks. It feels g
(to the Scotch) Ah, I remember you...Camel would've loved this stuff.
Camels drink scotch? Jacob laughs, shaking his head No. Charlie pours another;
You really got here on you're own?
The Great Escape! But I got lost.
I should call the home, let them know where you are.

I don't know why they call it a "home". You don't know anybody there. They fill you so full of drugs, you don't care...Five kids and not one has a place for me since their mother died. They take turns visiting me on weekends. They forgot whose turn it was today so nobody showed up..
I had a life, ya know. A big life...It isn't right. Charlie empathizes. Pours another. Changes the subject.
So, how did the Benzini Brothers stampede start? The story is two guys got thrown off the train and--
No point in telling a story if all you want to know is the end.
Sorry. From the beginning. 5.
Now, let's see...the beginning... Well, everything began the same day everything ended...Ha, isn't that how it always works?...
A mirrored medicine cabinet closes revealing the reflecti of JACOB JANKOWSKI - 23 years old, handsome, full of ener
It was a big day. My final exams.

Jacob bounds down the stairs and into the kitchen. JACOB'S MOTHER AND FATHER are finishing up breakfast. The Father tunes a Philco Radio while smoking a pipe...The Mo pours coffee wearing a cardigan sweater and pearls. Late for class, Jacob grabs a piece of bread and bacon an downs a coffee as his mother sweetly scolds him in POLISH His father says something supportive in POLISH as well. J thanks him in POLISH. He kisses his mother and exits.
A simple, clapboard house in a middle class neighborhood. Jacob runs out, passing his father's sign on the front la
Doctor of Veterinary Medicine EXT. CORNELL UNIVERSITY CAMPUS - 1931 - ITHACA, NY - DAY. The beautiful campus of Cornell University. Jacob runs.

After six years of dissections, castrations, foalings and shoving my arm up a cow's ass more times than I cared to remember, I was finally going to graduate Cornell in Veterinary Science. I was summa cum laude...ha,ha and the oldest male virgin on campus. 6.

Jacob sits beside a beautiful Blonde who distracts him wi her legs. She notices him staring, crosses her legs and smooths her skirt. VETERINARY SCIENCES FINAL EXAMS is written on the board o Lecture Hall. The Proctor announces from his desk.
You may begin. Jacob, the Blonde and fifty other students open their exa booklets and begin under The PROCTOR's supervision.

I had my whole life planned. I knew exactly where it was taking me... And then, with the opening of a door, it all vanished. The Lecture Hall door opens and DEAN WILKINS enters. The walks to the Proctor and they confer privately. Then:
Mr. Jankowski? May we have a word? Fifty pairs of eyes turn to look at Jacob, who looks up.
Jacob steps outside with Dean Wilkins.
Jacob, it's your parents. I'm afraid there's been a car accident.
Jacob walks down a dimly lit hall with a Police Chief and Chaplain to the Morgue led by a Nurse. We follow them ins

The room is windowless and bare except for TWO GURNEYS, e with a sheet-covered body. A CORONER stands between them. Jacob sees a steel table upon which lay his parents belongings; wedding rings, pearl necklace, his father's p 7.
Are you ready? The Chaplain places a comforting hand on Jacob's shoulder Jacob nods. The Coroner exposes first Jacob's father, the Jacob's mother. We see only Jacob's expression:
Is there any other family to call?
No. Just me.
Jacob, in a black suit. Mr. Hyde is seated opposite him.
I know this is difficult for you, but there's been no mistake. The house and all their assets, including your father's practise, are now property of the bank in default of the mortgage.
But I'm telling you, my father put away every penny he ever earned. They owned that house outright. Why would he have a mortgage?
My guess is because he let people pay him in beans & eggs or whatever they had, instead of money.
And so he's penalized for not turning away people who couldn't afford his help? He was a doctor.

Yes, I know, he was a very good man but in banking terms, in the reality of what makes this world actually function, he was an irresponsible man. I'm sorry, but you oughta to know the truth. This Depression is going to last for a long while..

..And the only ones who will be standing at the end of it, are the ones who fight to take what they need to survive. Everyone else is going to disappear. Don't make the same mistakes as your father. Jacob is disturbed by this description of his father.
Jacob in his black suit walking home..looks up ahead to s
All the family possessions are on the lawn being scoured by strangers: father's Philco radio, mother's jewelry...A foreclosure sign hangs beside his father's business sign:

Things happened so fast, my head was spinning. And that mortgage...I just couldn't figure it out. A DELIVERY TRUCK pulls up at the curb. It is met by A BAN REPRESENTATIVE, who receives a package and carries it to Jacob, meeting him halfway.
This just came for you, Jacob. Whatever it is I'm going to have to include in the bank's report of assets. Sorry. You OK?
I also have documents to sign.. The Bank Representative continues MOS as Jacob opens the package,

I didn't believe the lawyer or the bank. My mother worked. They had savings. We were never broke. So why would they need a mortgage? And then it hit me... Jacob opens the package revealing a BRAND NEW SIGN, readi

They did it to pay for my Ivy League education. For a moment Jacob can't move. This thought stuns him. Wi his house being picked apart and the Bank Representative speaking about papers, Jacob can't take it any longer. He drops the sign and walks away. The Bank Rep calls after h
Jacob? Jacob they need these signed by the end of the business day. Jacob walks away from the Bank Rep, pulling off his tie a tossing it. He is crying - the reality finally hitting hi

I walked and I kept on walking... It's a strange feeling becoming an orphan the same time you're becoming a man...To have this freedom to be anything you want at the same time everything you were is taken away. So I just walked ...Then all of a sudden, I stopped.
Jacob stands with his feet in a clear stream. He is no lo crying. There are dense woods, pitch black, all around hi

Like I'd been sleepwalking and I woke up. I had no idea where I was. Jacob can hear the buzz of insects, the glow of fireflies the cries of distant animals in the woods. It unnerves hi Far off beyond the dense woods Jacob sees A MOVING FLICKE LIGHT - like a distant, silent star moving past the trees The Light is moving around the woods until it curves towa Jacob's direction. He hears a distant CLANK-CLANK... Curious, Jacob puts his shoes on and walks back to a grav path that leads to TRAIN TRACKS just as: THE MASSIVE TRAIN ENGINE EXPLODES INTO VIEW PASSING HIM. Jacob is so close, he is hit by a wall of wind that nearl knocks him down. It is dark and the train is moving fast. 10.

What is it inside of us makes us decide to grab onto life again and again, no matter how many times it abandons us without a second thought?...What is it makes us hungry for more of the same? Somebody smart should figure that one out. Jacob makes his decision: He runs parallel to the train...stumbling over gravel, pitching forward and losin his balance, recovering, then running faster, scanning fo something to grab hold of to hoist himself up. He sees: AN OPEN STOCK CAR IS THREE CARS BEHIND HIM...As it catche to him, he lunges forward, reaching for the iron grab hol and flings himself upward. He clings on with his left leg elbow and chin. His right hand clings to the grab hold. W his left hand, he claws the floorboards of the stock car, the aged wood scraps off under his fingers. His right leg dangling, beneath the train itself, dangerously close to tracks. Jacob is slipping...slipping... With everything he's got, Jacob makes one final "life or death" effort, managing to get his left knee up over the edge. Using foot, knee, chin, elbow and fingernails, he scrapes his way inside the stock car and lies panting...
A dim light barely illuminates the interior. Jacob breath brief sigh of relief and accomplishment when suddenly: A

head_text.subj: HAND CONNECTED TO A EVEN LARGER ARM COMES OUT OF THE
DARKNESS, GRABBING JACOB BY HIS COLLAR, HOISTING HIM UP.

text: Jacob swings at this Brute with his free arm but it's blo easily, as the Brute moves him to the open car door.

Oh, don't go messin with Blackie. Throwing people off of trains is one of the perks of his job. Jacob can now see THREE MEN playing cards by a kerosene l ONE MAN HAS A RIFLE, aimed at Jacob. Another, A SHRUNKEN, STUBBLE FACED OLD TIMER, drinks out of a jug... Blackie holds Jacob out on the edge of the open stock car trees slam against the train almost cutting Jacob's face. 11.
We don't need no bums on this train brother. You can get off right now and keep running. Old Timer rises with a lantern and hobbles on one bad leg inspects Jacob and his nice suit with the lantern...
Now everybody calm down here. Grady put that damn rifle away. BLACKIE LET'IM GO...And I mean on the inside of the train! Jacob struggles as Blackie pins one arm behind him.

I'm tellin ya, ya can't red light him, we don't need that trouble. Look at them clothes - he's no bum. Blackie scans Jacob's clothes, then tosses him inside the train and returns to the card game. Jacob pants, relieved
Don't be sore kid. It's more like a reflex with Blackie. I'm Camel..And that there's Grady. And Bill.
Jacob. Jankowski. Nice to meet you.
You're pretty young for the rails. You running from something boy? You on the lam?
No. Nothing like that.
Where you headed?
I don't know.
Hungry? Outta work?
No shame in it. What can you do?
About anything I guess. 12. Camel gives him the once-over look then offers the jug.
We land in Deposit in the morning. We'll find you some work. And if you're still alive by the end of it, I'll get you some food and take you to Uncle August. Jacob drinks and chokes on the liquor.
Who's that?
August Rosenbluth...Lord and Master of the Known and Unknown Universes. Ringmaster Extraordinaire. Jacob looks baffled. Camel laughs as he drinks more;
Oh kid, don't tell me you didn't notice? Grady and Bill laugh though Blackie remains un-amused.
Ha, he really don't know.

HA! You didn't just jump a train boy. You jumped the Flying Squadron of the Benzini Brothers Most Spectacular Show on Earth... You done landed your ass on a circus, kid! PRE-LAP: The Circus Train brakes screeching to a halt! INT. STOCK CAR - DEPOSIT, NY - DAWN. Jacob is rolled awake as the train stops. He is disorient as Blackie, Grady and Bill jump out through the open stoc car door. Camel is fast asleep, drunk from the jug. EXT. CIRCUS TRAIN/CIRCUS GROUNDS - DEPOSIT, NY - DAWN. The Train has stopped adjacent to a huge grassy lot. Beyo it, the scattered buildings of Deposit, NY backlit by daw 13. Jacob jumps out of the stock car, in awe of what he sees: Hundreds of dirty, unshaven men pouring out of the train like ants on candy. The wagons of the train are painted scarlet red with gold trim and sunburst wheels. Emblazone each wagon; BENZINI BROTHERS MOST SPECTACULAR SHOW ON EAR Jacob wanders as the Circus is being created: Canvas tent are raised, the Big Top laying sprawled on the ground. Me standing over seams, lacing pieces together...Eight man sledge teams pound stakes into the ground at breakneck speed....Teams of men are raising enormous poles with the combined weight, chanting: Pull it! Shake it! Break it! Again!...Now down stake it!...Several teams horses pullin wagons are charging right for Jacob.. Jacob jumps out of the way, nearly being run down. He is of place...in the way of this finely tuned machine. Jacob ducks into a LARGE TENT for safety.

Jacob enters. A stillness takes the place of the chaos outside: The translucent tent is as tall as the sky. It h barely been set up - just the tent and: THE ANIMALS. Jacob is in awe. Camels, llamas, zebras and horses stand behind low ropes slung between iron stakes, some with the heads in mounds of hay.....Two giraffes stand within a ch link fence....lions, tigers, panthers, jaguars, bears, ch and an Orangutan. The animals stop moving, as if to give Jacob an acknowledgement. Jacob responds with a nod or a smile. The Orangutan is stretching it's arm outside it's den for something out of reach. Jacob tries to understand.

What is it? What do you want? The Orangutan strains its arm. Blinking at him. Pointing. Jacob looks around and sees A HALF SQUASHED ORANGE on the ground in front of the cage. He picks it up. Jacob opens the den and hands the Orangutan the orange. S takes it and sets it on the floor of her den. She returns reaches out for Jacob again. 14. Jacob hesitates, not knowing what she wants. But deciding trust her, Jacob extends his hand to hers. The Orangutan wraps her long fingers around Jacob's hand holds it for a beat, looking to his face. Jacob returns t gaze, realizing she is thanking him. He is touched.
You're welcome, ma'am. The Orangutan lets go and returns to the orange in her de
What the hell you doing in here? Get outta there!! You ain't a menagerie man. Only menagerie men is allowed in there. Jacob runs out to Camel.
Camel escorts Jacob through the grounds to a baggage car.
Gonna try to get you set up with Crazy Joe.
Do I call him Crazy Joe?

It has been said Crazy Joe went to prison for killing a man who spit into the wind and hit the back of Joe's neck. So no, I would not call this man Crazy Joe to his face. Camel and Jacob walks on to an open stock car door, where CRAZY JOE stands - a burly man, missing three fingers.
Hey Joe! I got a First of May here. Think you can use him? Crazy Joe scans Jacob, shoots an oyster of dark brown tob juice then disappears back inside. Camel tells Jacob;
You're in, kid. 15.
Jacob and another Young Man, WADE, with their shirts off, shovelling tons of horse manure. Jacob is queasy, blinkin from the stench. The Young Man doesn't seem bothered.
I've never seen so much manure!
Baggage stock horses. They pack'em in 27 a car.
How do you stand the smell?
What smell?

Jacob and several other Flying Squadron men struggle to p on cables hoisting up the canvases on the Big Top. It tak tremendous effort. Jacob uses every bit of strength. When the Big Top is raised, Jacob can't help but be impre with the accomplishment as the local townsfolk (rubes) ch
Jacob struggles to shovel LLAMA manure out of the menager He checks his hands - they are blistered and bleeding.

CECIL, THE BARKER, is "speechifying" from a platform besi the sideshow entrance, strutting back and forth, as a cro gathers... Jacob and other working men, including Wade, a positioned around the perimeter of the crowd.

When Cecil gives the signal ya gotta push the rubes in towards the entrance but without them catching on or else they'll be a fight. Jacob, Wade and the other men position themselves equidis around the perimeter of the crowd facing Cecil. 16. When Cecil pulls his ear (the Signal)...Jacob and the oth men move forward, inching the crowd into the sideshow ten
Jacob shovels YAK manure more easily having taped his blistered hands. EXT. BARBARA'S SHOW TENT - DEPOSIT, NY - LATE AFTERNOON. Grady hands Jacob a long lead pipe.

Stand inside the tent and smack the sides with this when you see a head trying to peek in without paying. Jacob follows Grady into the tent... INT. BARBARA'S SHOW TENT - CONTINUOUS - LATE AFTERNOON. Jacob enters and is paralyzed by what he sees: Camera angles behind BARBARA - a topless woman on stage a in front of rows of ogling men - as she maneuvers her bre in circles flipping the tassels attached to them...The me hoot and holler for more as Barbara smiles encouragingly, hiding her routine boredom. Jacob is paralyzed by the sight of a naked woman. Grady frantically motions for Jacob to snap out of it and the pipe at the heads sneaking under the tent to peek in. Startled out of his enthrallment, Jacob lifts the pipe to quickly and hits his own forehead. OW!..then proceeds to his job, banging the heads thru the flaps.

Jacob shovels ZEBRA manure, no longer affected by the sce By this point, the menagerie tent has been fully installe Ten chandeliers hang and twinkle from the roof illuminati the a gloriously bannered candy stand in the tent's cente Jacob hears someone entering the menagerie. He turns to s 17. Behind the rows of beautiful black and white horses, Jaco catches flashes of pink sequins...pink tights...pink sequ gloves of a WOMAN caressing and whispering to them. She is MARLENA. Her shimmering eyes and hair. Her porcela skin. Her pink sequins make her glisten and sparkle... Jacob is spellbound as he watches Marlena's gift with hor Marlena uses signals with her whip or clicking sounds wit her tongue to communicate with the horses: they line up a her subtle command, they raise their hooves, they bow dow her, rise up on their hind legs... She clicks her tongue and one White Silver Maned Horse li a hoof for her to inspect. She clicks for him to take a s Jacob notices the Silver Maned Horse walks tenderly on th foot. He decides to help....Approaching the shimmering Marlena, Jacob looks like he's been shovelling shit all d
Excuse me, ma'am? Hi. I'm Jacob. Marlena doesn't respond. She looks at him with suspicion.

May I? He may be foundering. Marlena nods. Jacob also clicks his tongue as he glides h hands up Silver Star's fetlock. To Marlena's surprise, th horse trusts Jacob, lifting its hoof. Jacob examines it.

He should be all right for tonight. But I'd put him on stall rest as soon as possible. He clicks his tongue and eases the hoof down. Marlena loo both impressed and insulted. Jacob smiles. Marlena does n She clicks and assembles her horses in formation, then le them out of the menagerie....Jacob looks after her adorin
Camera follows Jacob into the Big Top ... 18.
Jacob arrives as we reveal:

head_text.subj: THE EXTRAORDINARY GRANDEUR OF THE SPEC
PLAYS. IN THE CENTER RING IS

text: Jacob can barely contain himself...The Audience - young a old - is captivated. Faces of poor Depression era townspe light up with joy and amazement; During Jacob's lines we see; Clowns, jugglers, acrobats, exotic animals, Marlena with her Horses, high divers on f diving into a tank of water...it is truly spectacular:

You never saw anything like it. You could hardly take it all in without fearing you might go blind from the shine. From one kind of world too hard to bear came some kind a heaven no one knew existed. End on Jacob seeing: Marlena gloriously atop her horses w form a tableau, as a curtain of sparks falls behind them.
The Big Top drops. Poles topple. Horses, men and equipmen dismantle the great city of tents.
And then just as quickly, heaven was packed away and gone.
As the train travels, a worn out Jacob sits cramped under bunk beside A CONTORTIONIST taking up little space. Jacob voraciously eats a plate of food Camel snuck in for him.
You like the food? You deserve it. You done good, I hear..
..Woah, you better take a breath before it all comes back up on ya. Here. Have a hit of Jake. He offers Jacob his "Jake". Jacob drinks and chokes.
It's an acquired taste. Now get yourself outta there. I'm gonna take you in to see August. As Jacob squeezes out, the Contortionist unwinds himself takes up more space.
But it's the middle of the night.
Only time circus people live - when they don't have to work. Come on...
Camel leads Jacob through various sleeping cars, revealin the lowly conditions of life on the road...wooden bunks, private space, one bathroom for a dozen to share.

head_text.subj: THROUGHOUT THIS NARRATION WE JUMP CUT INTO VARIOUS CARS

text: - The Musicians Car: Men smoking, cleaning instruments...looking at Jacob with suspicion and wry hum The Trumpet Player plays TAPS. Jacob doesn't understand w

I got a son about your age. Lives outside of Reading, PA. Haven't seen him for years. Fix your shirt there. Jacob shoves in his shirt. Camel smiles. He likes the kid - The Clown Car: Clowns without make-up reading or playin cards. They look at Jacob as if he were walking the last mile. One Clown waves goodbye.

Remember, when you meet August let him do the talking and don't ever mention Ringling. He hates them bastards worse than the Depression. 20. - Barbara and the Coochie Girls Car; Girls in various for of undress, negligees, sheer robes. Barbara exits a bathr and bumps into Jacob, who fumbles seeing her half-nude;
How's your pipe, kid? Camel leads the slack-jawed Jacob away.
Night ladies.
Night Camel.
Slightly more upscale and private quarters with a passeng aisle outside individual doors and windows.
Hey Camel - who's that woman who works the horses?

Now stop right there. That's Marlena. She don't talk to nobody and you don't talk to her. And don't mention her to August. Ain't no right way to talk about somebody's wife and make it sound like a compliment.
Wife? Camel takes this opportunity to drink some Jake and ask:

Look, kid, before we do this, I gotta ask... ..I ain't tryin to know your business but I do know you ain't been on the road too long. You're too clean, your clothes too nice and you don't got a possession on you. See, a man on the road collects little things. It's not a big life I can tell ya. So before you start, I ask: if you got any kind of life to go back to, that's what you should do. 21. Jacob stops. He tries to not sound emotional when he says
I don't. Camel studies him, as if understanding what isn't said.
I am sorry to hear that. They move on.
They reach a platform facing the fanciest car yet. Standi upon it is an enormous, muscular BALD MAN, EARL...
This here's Earl. He's gonna take you in. Earl, this here's Jacob.
(shakes hands w/Camel) I don't know how to thank you.
HA! You may not want to after you been on a show long as I have. Good luck to ya, kid. Camel exits OS. Alone with Earl, Jacob asks:
Do I look OK?
Very nice. Then, with one hand Earl slides back the door and with th other hand, violently grabs Jacob by the neck and throws head first into the car.

Jacob falls into Uncle August's opulent private car, with wood panelling, cushioned furniture and chandeliers. Sitting at a table playing cards are CECIL the Barker, DIAMOND JOE (menagerie and ring stock), MR. ERWIN (talent booker), CRAZY JOE (baggage stock) and, with his back to in a high wing back chair, (UNCLE) AUGUST ROSENBLUTH. 22. Earl shoves him against the wall, dangling him off the fl As August speaks to Jacob, all we see is the back of his and smoke from his cigar as he plays cards throughout...
What's this?
That stowaway the old drunk took under his wing. College boy. Jacob tries to explain but Earl bangs him against the wal
(to the game) I'll see your three and raise you five...
I don't believe I've had the pleasure.
Jacob Jankowski, sir.
And what is a "Jacob Jankowski" and why he is on my train?
Just looking for work, sir.
Can you fly? Set yourself on fire?
No sir.
Ever worked a show, son?
No sir.
Ever been to a show?
Yes sir... Jacob, sensing where this is going, gets August's attenti 23.

Ringling Brothers. August stops playing cards. The others react with sudden apprehension. Earl casually shakes his head to warn Jacob August finally rises and turns to Camera: handsome, charismatic, fiercely intelligent...matinee idol looks th mask a darker nature.
Ringling, you say?
Yes. But it was terrible.
Really? Have you seen our show?
What was your favorite act? Jacob sees a CIRCUS POSTER with Marlena and her Horses.
The uh...the one with the black and white horses. And the girl in pink.
Ah, our Star Attraction. Well, I believe we're looking for a boy to carry water for the elephants, aren't we Diamond Joe?
We don't have an eleph-
Shut-up.
I would do that, sir. I'd like to work with the animals. August and the others chuckle. Jacob doesn't understand w August crosses to Jacob, as he ridicules:
And you'd carry water for elephants? Ha, ha...you have any idea how much water an elephant drinks, kid? College! Pfft! Never met a college man yet who knew his own ass from shinola.

You eat my food and you ride my train like you're entitled to survive. But you see, nothing survives here without my permission...Maybe if you tell me you're nothing, I'll let you stay, although my bet is you won't last. Jacob refuses to let August demean him. He stays silent.
You smell like every kind of shit. Why would a college boy want that?

Times are hard for everybody...And I guess because ... out of all the dirt and sweat and shit and working with fellas you don't want to be caught dead meeting in the daylight, comes...so much beauty. We think August and the men are moved by Jacob's words.
That's beautifully put.
Toss him off, Earl. And make sure you see the red light before you red light him. As Earl drags Jacob in tow, August derides him to the oth
Another sonny boy mad at mommy and daddy for paying the bills. Sounds like he studied poetry.
I got no use for people who rhyme.

(shouts as he is dragged) It was veterinary science! And I can tell you one thing - that Star Attraction horse of yours won't be walking in a few days let alone performing center ring!! August stops and turns.
Earl wait! 25. Earl stops with Jacob. Now all the men are intrigued...
Veterinary science? (Earl stops with Jacob) May I ask what school?
Cornell.
You're a Cornell graduate? Jacob lies and nods...August wonders whether to trust Jac
Marlena did want a vet to take a look at Silver Star. They cost.
He worked the rubes for me this afternoon. Pretty good.
He shovelled horse shit. Don't make him a horse doctor. August looks reluctant. Until Jacob caps it:
I hear Ringling has its own vet. The other men can't believe Jacob spoke up like this. But amuses August, who faces him and smiles;
All right, Cornell. Come with me. August leads Jacob out.
August and Jacob exit onto the platform.
Are you sure-footed, Jacob Jankowski?
I believe so. 26.
Good. Without missing a beat, August leans forward, catches hol something around the side of the car and disappears.
The train jerks a curve. Jacob almost falls.

Jacob looks up to see: August is on the roof of the train: his face moonlit, his hair blowing wildly in the wind...He points downward. Jacob, none too pleased, advances to the edge of the plat as the train speeds by, and looks where August is pointin He can see the edge of a thin iron ladder. He wipes his h on his thighs. Focuses. Then leaps... Jacob's right hand meets the ladder. His left grasps wild until it ensnares the other side. His feet jam into the rungs. Jacob climbs to the roof.
August gives Jacob a hand up and they sit cross legged.

head_text.subj: THE NIGHT, BENDING ROUND A CURVE.

text: It's a breath taking sight, isn't it? Always gets me.

I can't get a new Liberty Horse mid- season. So you make sure this horse performs and the job's yours. Nine bucks a week. If you cross me, I'll feed you to my meat eaters and there won't be a trace left of you... Jacob hangs on every word. August smiles;

You do right by me, Jacob Jankowski...I'll show you what it's like to travel every inch of this country, every inch of this world, and be welcomed home in every street, be loved in every town...I'll give you a life most suckers can't dream of. Jacob is mesmerized by August. August stands and tap danc across the roofs. Jacob has no choice but to follow... The two men dance and leap atop the train from car to car across the moving train...Jacob grows increasingly confid and euphoric following August's exultant lead.

August drops into the Ring Stock Car followed by Jacob. O one side is a line of Marlena's Black and White Show Hors The other side, there is a makeshift door. August kicks through the door, revealing a small room;

This makeshift room is lit by a kerosene lamp on a crate to a cot, propped up by a wall of trunks. A DWARF "KINKO" (WALTER) is reading on his cot. He has re hair. He and August greet each other with polite disgust.
Kinko.
August.
This is Jacob. He's going to bunk with you a while.
How do you do?
What is he?
I said his name is Jacob. 28.
I asked what, not who.
He's going to help out in the menagerie.
A menagerie man? Performers don't bunk with working men. There's a growl from his loyal Russell terrier, QUEENIE.
Well there are performers.. (his hand indicates high

And then there are performers.. (his hand indicates lower "Kinko" standard) Considering we used to keep the goats in here, I'm sure Marlena's horses out there object to now sharing their quarters with you. Of course I can always change that and send you back to a bottom bunk with the other kinkers who sorely miss your sunny personality and affectionate camaraderie. (Kinko knows this threat) This gentleman is the show's new veterinarian - Ivy League no less - which puts him a good deal higher than you in my estimation. Perhaps you'd like to offer him your cot. As the kerosene lamp light flickers in August's face, Kin knows he has no choice. August smiles and turns to leave.
I'll find you in the morning. Sleep well, Cornell. August exits....Jacob is left staring at resentful Kinko Queenie, who snarls at him. Jacob tries to be friendly:
A Jack Russell. They're very smart.
Queenie attack. 29. Queenie jumps at Jacob, growling, hunch backed. Jacob is pressed against the wall. Kinko returns to his book.
You're not getting the cot. EXT. CIRCUS GROUNDS - LIBERTY, NY - DAWN. Jacob is washing himself with dirty water out of a bucket beside Camel. Camel starts hitting his leg. He laughs:
Ha, this gam of mine keeps falling asleep on me. Pretty soon the only place for me is going to be selling tickets but I'm too ugly for that.
Jacob! Camel straightens up when August appears, clearly on his guard. He turns his back to continue washing.

We can do better than this for our new vet. I'll arrange for you to start getting your own water bucket like the performers and bosses. Two buckets per person. Come... August walks away as Jacob hurries to follow...
See ya Camel.
(sips his Jake) Yeah, take care kid.
August and Jacob enter a more upscale tent where male performers are washing from personal buckets of water.
You'll need new clothes too. I'll set you up with the Monday Man.
Monday Man? 30.
What day of the week did your mother hang out the wash to dry?
He takes other people's clothes?
It's the Depression, Cornell. Where have you been? Oh right - Cornell. Kinko is bathing with his two buckets when August snatche one of them away.
Here, use Kinko's second bucket for now.
You barely use up one. Kinko fumes. Jacob tries to placate.
August, it's all right, I'll--
If you need a razor, there are some back there with my name on them. August walks away. Jacob follows August away from Kinko.
August.. When August stops, Jacob is caught off guard...
It's good to have an educated man like you around. I need one other sane individual in this operation.
Thank you for everything, August. August pats his back and exits. Jacob heads for the bucke
Ah...Jacob? 31.
Yes, August?
The horse. August wants Jacob to follow him to the horse. Jacob thou he was going to bathe.
Oh! Yes...The horse. Jacob follows behind August's commanding stride.
Diamond Joe and GREG, a ring stock man in overalls, are leading the Marlena's horses out of the ring stock car...

I'm sure it's nothing serious. Don't tell my wife I said this but she coddles them too much. She has a particularly strong affection for Silver Star. I don't encourage it. It's unhealthy to love an animal that much...Here she is. Marlena runs up to them, still in her bed clothes/robe.
Darling, meet Jacob Jankowski, Benzini Brothers own veterinarian.
It's a pleasure to meet you. Marlena barely acknowledges Jacob - keeping their previou meeting a secret (for which Jacob is grateful). August pu his arm around her and they kiss.
Last stall. Lead the way, doc. They enter the ring stock car... 32.
Jacob, Marlena and August arrive at the stall to see Silv Star is laying down. He is breathing heavily, his rib cag rising and falling. Jacob immediately senses the worst.

Jesus, Marlena, he wasn't this bad in the show. Jacob moves to examine the horse, but he flinches in pain Marlena takes over, by sitting besides Silver Star's head and stroking his head while singing a soft lullaby. Jacob registers Marlena's soothing effect causes Silver S to relax...his breathing grows calmer. So Jacob begins to examine him as Marlena watches protectively. Jacob runs his right hand down the leg to the fetlock. He lays his hand on the hoof then place his thumb and forefi on the back of the fetlock. He looks at the sole of the h which is bulging and dark with a red line around the edge Jacob's expression tells us this is a bad sign.
Is that the problem?
Do you need any hoof testers? Diamond Joe has them...
Not yet.

Well, how are you going to fix it? Marlena looks at him coolly, expecting an explanation. Ja doesn't want to tell her the truth. Jacob looks to August and rises, leaving Marlena with the horse. Jacob pulls August away to whisper.
I didn't want to say anything in front of... Mrs. Rosenbluth...he's already foundering.
English. 33.

This horse isn't getting back on his feet, August. If there was anything I could do, I would but we're going to have to put him down...I'm real sorry. Beat. August's stares at Jacob - or rather, stares throug him. A dead stare that lasts just a beat or two too long...And then just as suddenly, the look is gone:
I know you are. Come with me. August exits. Jacob doesn't know what this means. He foll
TWO BUCKETS FILLED WITH PUTRID MEAT. Flies buzzing on top Diamond Joe finishes filling the buckets as August grabs
Joe, bad report for Silver Star I'm afraid. Jacob here says there's no hope. We're going to have to put him down... Diamond Joe registers a concerned, anxious look to Jacob.
...So I need you to round up Pete and Greg, get a wagon and a harness stretcher. He has to be hauled.
A harness what?
Jacob and I'll take care of the cats. We'll meet you back at the stall.
Grab the other bucket, will you? Diamond Joe seems uneasy about this as we follow August a Jacob, who comments on the putrid meat.
August, this stuff has gone off. Do the cats really eat this? 34.
No, they really love goats. (Jacob looks to him) We're all out of goats.
Jacob waits with the buckets outside the car. August is inside unlocking the padlocks, then reappears and jumps o
Go ahead. They get a bucket each. Apprehensive, Jacob hops up. August hands him the buckets

The cat dens have two compartments: to the left is a pair lions. To the right, a tiger and a panther. All are massi As soon as Jacob appears, they lift their heads ominously August has unlocked the dens but left the padlock hanging the cage bars. The animals can smell the buckets now. The growl. Jacob is a bit unhinged:
What do I do, just open the door and toss it in?

Unless you think a formal sit-down is appropriate. Jacob approaches the tiger first. The six hundred pound c rises then roars, his massive head hitting the cage and rattling the lose padlock. Jacob freezes.

Why don't you start with Rex... that's him on the left. August is pointing to one of the lions - with a ratty man and visible rib cage. Smaller than the tiger, Jacob has a more nerve. He reaches for a bucket...August suddenly sho unnerving Jacob even more:

Not that one, that one. 35. He points to a difference bucket. Jacob can see no differ between them, but no matter. He lifts the bucket and approaches the lion's cage. Rex, the lion, lunges at the door. Jacob freezes.

What's the matter? Didn't they cover this in school? August is having a grand time. Jacob smirks. Rex is rubbi his mangy coat against the cage bars. Jacob fumbles, removing the padlock and laying it at his feet. He lifts the bucket and waits. When Rex turns away the cage door, Jacob swings it open. But before he can sp out the contents of the bucket: Rex turns and chomps his huge jaw down on Jacob's arm. JA SCREAMS. The bucket drops, spilling the entrails inside w cause Rex to release Jacob's arm and attack the food. Jacob slams the cage shut and checks to see if he has an He does but it is dripping with saliva and as red as if h dipped it in boiling water. But no skin is broken. August is hysterically laughing. Furious, Jacob storms of
What the hell is wrong with you? You think that's funny?
Yes I do! Aw Jacob wait! Don't be sore! I was having a little fun!
FUN! I could have lost my arm!
Rex hasn't got any teeth... Jacob feels more foolish and walks away, when, just as quickly, August's tone of voice turns darker:
Jacob.. Jacob stops and turns. August isn't laughing any more. He that sniper's stare of August's darker side...August move towards Jacob, almost menacingly, as he speaks; 36.

..people want their money back when the Star Act on the poster isn't in the ring! A Star Attraction keeps a circus alive. Without it, animals eat that and men eat nothing. It takes time to find and train another horse so without Silver Star, I have no Star Act.
I don't know how he's been performing August, but you don't have a Star Act now. That horse can't walk and if he does you'll lose him. He's in a lot of pain.
Like this? August squeezes Jacob's sore arm from Rex's attack. Jacob cries out in pain as August holds his grip yet speaks cal

We always have choices, Jacob - a choice between our pain and someone else's. That horse was performing before you came and he will continue to perform until he drops dead. I'm telling you to keep it alive and that's what you'll do or you'll be red lit like anyone else who doesn't obey the law here. Every nation has it's own laws under God, Jacob. You left America the second you jumped my train. I like you. Believe me, I do. I'm only thinking of your future. August lets go of his arm and walks away. Jacob is angry.

Angry, Jacob inspects his arm - swollen and red from Rex' mouth. He hears: O.S. murmuring coming from Silver Star's stall. He approaches to find Marlena sitting at Silver St head, stroking his nose and humming the lullaby. Marlena strokes Silver Star as Jacob appears. And Marlena speaks to him for the first time; 37.
Tell me the truth. What's wrong with him? Jacob hesitates before answering, then:

The connective tissues between the hoof and the coffin bone are compromised and the coffin bone rotates toward the sole of the hoof. If he keeps walking, it'll puncture through...He's in a lot of pain.
And if he rests?
You'll lose him anyway. I'm sorry. Marlena breaths in this bad news and braces herself, tear welling up in her eyes.
Then you have to put him down. Jacob is impressed by her...and a little surprised.
It's the right thing to do.
But August won't let you.
(Beat. Then:) If I'm the show's vet then it's my decision, isn't it?
But August won't like it.
Then it'll be my last decision. Marlena is impressed by Jacob. And surprised. She doesn't quite know what to make of him. 38.
A determined, pent-up Jacob marches towards Bill and Grad who are taking a break, smoking. Camel is drinking Jake..
Hey kid. What are you doing on the wrong side of the tracks?
I need a gun.
It can't be that bad... They laugh but Jacob insists boldly.

I need a gun! Or a rifle! Now! Grady leans inside the open car door and gets him a rifle Jacob takes it and marches back. They watch him, curiousl Jacob passes Blackie on the way and boldly ignores his intimidating stance....Performers and workmen sense a dra brewing and follow Jacob to see what is happening.
Jacob jumps into the Ring Stock car with the rifle as Kin exits his room with Queenie. Queenie growls.
What do you think you're doing?
Shut-up! Both of you! Jacob continues on to Silver Star and Marlena.
You should go.

No. I'll keep him calm. Jacob respects Marlena's fortitude...Jacob raises the rif and aims, trembling...Stoic Marlena, tears in her eyes, t her face away...Jacob pauses, upset...then...shoots. 39. Jacob's distraught expression tells us everything as the rifle slides to his side. He looks to Marlena. This is th first moment of intimacy. She rises and takes the rifle f his grip. She sees his arm bruised from the cats. She see to know what it means. She offers a respectful farewell.

I'll be sorry to see you go, Mr. Jankowski. She exits O.S. with the rifle. INT. MENAGERIE TENT - LIBERTY, NY - LATER - EVENING. The yaks are motionless. Flies buzz around their head and ears. Jacob swats them away...The Polar Bear is on his stomach, breathing heavily. Jacob smooths his coat....Jac leans down and hoists a bucket of ice, scattering the ice near the polar bear who rolls closer to it. Jacob sees Rex, lying on his side in his cage, panting wi thirst. He brings a bucket of water to Rex's cage and ope it. Rex gets to his feet but this time Jacob doesn't flin He isn't frightened. He gives Rex the bucket of water. Re drinks as Jacob strokes his mane, which Rex allows...

Friends now? August calmly enters the menagerie with the rifle. He wal to the center and stops, staring at Jacob. Jacob goes about caring for the animals - moving from one the next - trying not to be unnerved by August's presence Then August does a surprising thing: He sits in the cente the menagerie, crossed legged, with the rifle beside him.
You've got a gift for them. Like Marlena with horses. It's God- given. I can always spot it. Jacob takes Bobo out of his den. Bobo hugs him tightly. H continues on as he replies;
My father used to say that to me.
He must have been a wise man. 40. This stops Jacob. Beat. He turns to August.
How is Marlena? August tilts his head curiously, with a smile.

You're a genuine curiosity Jacob Jankowski. What am I to do with you? ... I threaten to throw you off a moving train, feed you to my lions and you go ahead and shoot my star horse anyway. So I think - Jacob's an educated man. For Jacob to disobey me and shoot that horse, that horse must have been in pretty bad shape. Perhaps bad enough to injure my Marlena during the show. And so I think Jacob Jankowski might be a valuable person to have around.
Tell Diamond Joe the animals need more water when the humidity's this bad if I don't see him before I go.
You're not going anywhere. You belong here. These animals..they've been waiting for you. Jacob doesn't know whether to believe him or not. Then:
But don't ever disobey me like that again. I'll give you this one. I'll call it "respect"...Next one I call "betrayal". Understood?
I do thank you though. You and Silver Star solved a much bigger problem for me. August pulls a pack of Camels from his pocket.
What problem? August lights, inhales, blows smoke then: 41.
The cats. You see, meat eaters are always more valuable to a circus than hay burners. And you saw what we had to feed them.
What does Silver Star have to do with the cats?

We should have just enough food for them to get us to the next show, thanks to you. Of course Marlena won't speak to me for a day or two but she'll come around...So, I was right. You are a valuable man. As he walks away, rifle over his arm, Jacob is unnerved;
August, what did you do? August?
Queenie sleeps. Kinko reads comic book porn inside a book Aristotle's Poetics. Jacob sits on his bed thinking.

I couldn't stop thinking about Marlena. I didn't see her for three days. Our shows were cancelled and we kept moving because, word was, August found a "dead one"... The train wheels screech as it begins to stop. Jacob rise and looks out of open train car doors..
The train is pulling into the site of a "ghost town" abandoned circus; a dilapidated Big Top, broken wagons an tents, desolate performers walking about idly or sitting the shade.
As the train pulls into Goshen, performers stick their he out the window to see....Jacob sits in the open stock car with Kinko and Queenie: 42.
Why are we stopping?

August loves his sideshow freaks. There's a guy with this outfit who has a parasitic twin growing out of his chest. He dresses it in a tiny tuxedo and black patent leather shoes. No talent but a real money- maker with the rubes. Calls himself the Man and a Half. Goddamn August'll pay him double what he pays me just for the irony.
What happened to this circus?

Went belly up. Pretty common nowadays. Circus bosses see the end coming and they'd pull a runner with all the money. Menagerie belongs to the town now. August can get anything he wants for a song. Jacob and Kinko watch August striding through the grounds desperate performers hopeful for work rush up to him.

Most of them will never belong to another show. And they know it. August is helped by Earl, who pushes the performers aside August can head straight for the Goshen TOWN OFFICIALS, standing beside an Oldsmobile. They exchange greetings.

Crazy Joe is organizing the Flying Squadron to take whate parts of the Fox Circus remains that they can use. Jacob is checking baggage stock horses when he sees: Marlena sitting alone outside her stateroom. He walks to Just as he reaches her, Marlena turns to him, looking as she hadn't slept in days. Before they can speak, they hea

head_text.subj: A CHAMPAGNE BOTTLE IS POPPED OPEN...

text: A deliriously happy August is walking and holding the champagne, pouring glasses held by Earl who then hands on each to Marlena, Jacob, Diamond Joe and Crazy Joe as they walk towards the Fox Bros. Menagerie Tent.
We have a new star!
The Man and a Half?
Nah, lousy Ringling got here first. But we got better! A bull!
A bull?
A bull elephant! Her name is Rosie, she's fifty-three and she's brilliant. The best bull they had. I'm going to come up with a whole new Star Act around her and Marlena..

You can ride her in the Spec from now on, since we have no Liberty Horse. August smiles at Marlena who looks back contemptuously, u about Silver Star. August ignores her. Jacob notices the exchange between them.
(Pours himself a glass.) ...Our own bull! Ringling can't hold that over us now. I'm renovating an entire car just for her.
Just for the elephant! But the bunkers are at capacity! I've got roustabouts three to a bunk. August tosses off this concern. 44.
We'll find places for everyone. And when our new star sells tickets, we'll buy another car! We're a show to be reckoned with now!

CAMERA POV: Dozens of Benzini Brothers work men are dismantling and taking what they need...As our characters walk through, this crowd of working men in constant motio part the way to reveal: ROSIE THE ELEPHANT: She is gargantuan. Ten feet tall at t shoulder. Her skin is mottled and cracked from the tip of trunk down to her feet. Only her ears are smooth. She has deeply set, amber eyes with extremely long lashes. She st tall behind a rope, chained to a stake in the ground. Jacob, Marlena, August, Diamond Joe and Greg observe her.
She has such long eye lashes.
She's a hundred if she's a day. We're lucky if she can move.

Darling, what do you think? She's magnificent, isn't she? Marlena keeps her rage silent, but it is all the more pot August decides to ignore it. Jacob keeps his eyes on Rosi but feels the tension between them. ROSIE'S CARETAKER approaches: filthy shirt behind suspend
You the bull man?
No. (Refers to Diamond Joe) This is my menagerie man. 45.
Where's your bull man? Ya got no bull man, I gotta tell the township or else they can't sell her to ya. August grabs Jacob's arm and shoves him forward;
Here he is. He's my bull man.. Rosie's Caretaker looks at the surprised Jacob, then:

All right. See this animal...this here's the stupidest Goddamn animal on the face of God's good earth....Here's your bull hook. You're gonna need it. He tosses A BULL HOOK - a wooden rod about three feet lon with a four inch metal pick coming off the end - to Jacob
I don't believe it. The mayor said she was the best bull you had.
If she was the best bull, why is she the only one left? You think you're the first show to turn up picking on the bones? August is annoyed. As the Caretaker gathers his things:

Some elephant tramp who dropped dead in Genesee sold her for a song which still ain't no bargain cause she ain't done a damn thing since but eat everything in sight. (Starts to walk away) Well, good luck to ya. And if I don't ever see another dumb bull in my life it'll be too soon.

Rosie pulls her trunk from the trough. She lifts, aims, a blasts the Caretaker with such a force, his hat sails off head in a stream of water. Jacob, August, Diamond Joe and Greg bite their lips from laughing. Marlena just stares into Rosie's eyes. 46. The Caretaker stops, his hair and clothes dripping. He doesn't turn, just stands still for a moment - then moves August's enthusiasm is slightly dampened.
Joe, you and Greg come with me. We have to find a car to renovate.
See what you can do with her. They exit. Jacob and Marlena are left alone with Rosie as Flying Squadron men continue to work in the tent. There i awkward pause between them...then:
Mrs. Rosenbluth, I hope I'm not speaking out of turn here but - but I had no idea they were going to do that to Silver Star.
I know....Thank you. This relaxes Jacob, but he senses she is still sad.
And please, call me Marlena. I'm not a snob like everybody thinks. Jacob smiles. He faces Rosie and tries to cheer Marlena u
Hello Rosie, I'm Jacob Jankowski. This is Mrs. Marlena Rosenbluth. Can you say Mrs. Marlena Rosenbluth? Marlena smiles as she watches Jacob stroke Rosie's hide.

You're a beauty, huh. Skin's a little dry, you oughta take care of that. First thing you notice about a woman's age is her skin. Rosie lifts her trunk and begins to explore Jacob's body. Marlena giggles. Jacob plays it up to make her laugh.
Are you flirting with me young lady? I usually like to make the first move...

(Her trunk taps his head) I like to get to know a girl first...take her out. Meet her folks... (Her trunk goes lower) Of course, aggressive women can be a nice change... (She tickles him) Jacob and Marlena laugh, her mood lightened because of Ja

I think you two are engaged. They laugh. Jacob is thrilled to have this effect on Marl A HARMONICA PLAYS A TUNE in the distance. They turn towar the sound and see that the two of them are alone in the t All the workmen have left. Jacob and Marlena turn back to Rosie who stands between t There is a awkward, lovely moment of intimacy between the three as Marlena strokes Rosie's trunk. Her hand and Jaco come very close to overlapping. When their eyes meet, one them quickly averts their glance...There is clearly a gro attraction between them. But it's uncomfortable.
I think Rosie likes music. That harmonica song is lovely.
I'm confessin that I love you. Marlena stops, her face flushed by Jacob's "confession".
What?
The name of the song. "I'm Confessin' That I Love You."
(overlaps, realizing) --"Confessin' that I love you." Beat. Jacob tries not to laugh. They return to stroking Rosie, trying not to look at each other.
Louis Armstrong. Right. 48. INT. KINKO'S ROOM - GOSHEN, NY - LATE AFTERNOON. Jacob enters. Kinko is on his bed reading his "Aristotle" quickly shuts the book. Queenie growls at Jacob.
Queenie stop. Queenie stops. Kinko returns to his book. Jacob sees a NE BED ROLL AND PILLOW, upon which sits a LETTER. He reads i

head_text.subj: COMPANY IN STATEROOM 3, CAR 48, FOR COCKTAILS AND SUPPER.

text: Jacob looks up to find Kinko staring at him.
What is it?
It's trouble, that's what. Not that I give a damn, but you're playing with dynamite with those two and you're gonna blow all of us up. August is the meanest sonofabitch I've ever met.
I admit he has his moments of insanity but he's really a very generous, charming guy.

You don't get it, do you? When August feeds your arm to a lion - that's the real August. The one who's generous and charming - that's the insane August. They hear a fight outside the car. They move to investiga INT/EXT. RING STOCK CAR - CONTINUOUS - LATE AFTERNOON. Jacob and Kinko look out of the open ring stock car to se August is standing before A MAN who is being held by Blackie's Men and punched by Blackie himself. The Man is bleeding and bruised. Various other performers and workin men also watch the brutality; 49.
Six men got red lit last night. Cancelling shows and that damn elephant cost August. He needed to clean house to save on payroll... It's a lousy day when an animal gets paid and men don't.
Why are they beating him?
He hid one of the men who was supposed to be tossed. Word was the train was over a trestle instead of land. Nobody comes back from that.

Get rid of him. He comes back on my property, you can shoot him. August walks away, with Earl and his men in tow. Blackie his men drag the beaten Man away. As they turn, Jacob recognizes the Man; It is WADE who worked Jacob on his first day.
August, wearing a tuxedo, opens the door on the platform.

JACOB! Come in, come in! Jacob enters their Stateroom which takes up half the car, with an additional room, cordoned off by a velvet curtain The main room is paneled in walnut and outfitted with dam furniture, a dinette and a Pullman kitchen.
Darling, our guest has arrived. Jacob's eyes go wide upon seeing Marlena who appears look radiant in a rose silk, off the shoulder evening dress.
I'm so glad you could come. Would you like a beer? Or champagne? 50.
I'm not dressed for champagne.
We can fix that, can't we darling? August winks at Marlena who giggles at their secret as Au ushers Jacob to the velvet curtain...
We're celebrating our new star, Rosie. My plan is to have the act ready for the Manhattan/Jersey show so she can start selling tickets.
Unfortunately we had to let some men go last night... Jacob listens to how August will explain this:

...I don't like doing it, not one bit. But to keep hard working men working, I had to get rid of lay- abouts and thieves who are dead weight. If I had the funds to pay them all I would, but times being as they are...I regret it though. Jacob believes him. August turns to him, with cheer:
So tomorrow, my faithful bull man, we begin! But tonight - we dine!! Tonight, we all deserve champagne! August whisks the velvet curtain aside:
Ta-dah! A tuxedo for Jacob, who smiles, impressed.

head_text.subj: COURSE OF THE EVENING ALONG WITH JACOB'S NARRATION

text: - Three white-gloved waiters remove the domes off of silv platters revealing oyster bisque, prime rib, boiled potat asparagus in cream. - Marlena's dress barely covers her shoulders, exposing h porcelain skin and the curves of her breasts. Jacob can barely keep his eyes off of her during dinner... 51. - Jacob is wiping his plate clean as August proudly offer more. Marlena laughs at Jacob's embarrassment when he realizes his plate is clean... - Wine is poured over and over...as the evening continues - August is at the center of conversation entertaining Marlena and Jacob. They are drunk from the wine!

Jacob, I want to apologize to you, in front of my darling Marlena so she can witness how truly sorry I am for any bit of nastiness between us...Running this show, the many pressures...It can get the best of me sometimes I'm afraid.
People don't realize how much August does holding everything together. How difficult it is in these times. The whole company is like a family to him.
Thank you my love. He kisses her hand then turns to Jacob;
From now on I shall trust your judgement in all things veterinarian. Please say you accept my apology. Jacob is enamoured with August again, especially seeing Marlena smiling in agreement.
Of course I do, August. You've been nothing but swell to me.
Good man!

I could truly use a friend I can trust. Jacob once again beams at the compliment as August pours wine. But Jacob feels a twinge of guilt. He stands to mak dramatic statement. August and Marlena look up to him. 52.
I have to tell you something. You may not trust me after you hear it. August and Marlena pause - giving Jacob their attention.
I never took my final exams at Cornell. I'm not a real vet. Beat. Then August and Marlena burst into laughter at the earnestness with which Jacob made his statement.
But it's true. I never got my degree. I'm not a licensed vet. They laugh even harder.

BAH! A worthless piece of paper from the ivy bush league! Of course you're a vet. You have the gift. You're idealism is just so...sweet. When are you going to learn that the rules written of, by and for these united states of suckers do not apply to us.
Not about this, August.
All right, let me ask you - do you honestly think this is the most spectacular show on earth?
(Beat. Then laughs) No.

No. It's nowhere near. Lucinda, our Fat Lady, isn't 800 pounds. Four at the tops. And you really think the Tattooed Man got tattooed by headhunters in Borneo? He's from Pittsburgh. Took him nine years to ink himself. And you know what I did when the hippo died? Swapped out her water for formaldehyde and kept showing her. For two weeks, we travelled with a pickled hippo..

(Jacob & Marlena laugh) ..The world is run on tricks - in here and out there. So trust me, it's having a talent that counts. In this world, it's all that's real. Look at this country, these dead, God awful towns we play. Talent and illusion bringing life to what is dead...Even for just a matinee. How wonderful is that? Jacob believes he's right. Marlena smiles in agreement. August rises to toast. Jacob and Marlena follow.
To talent and illusion!
To Rosie!
And Silver Star. August takes a beat and smiles warmly at Marlena...

To all we love. He leans over and kisses Marlena longer than appropriate front of a guest. Jacob downs his wine, closing his eyes. Suddenly, August grabs Jacob and Marlena and pulls them u dance, throwing his arm around them both as we hear: Loui Armstrong's DREAM A LITTLE DREAM OF ME. August starts singing along, imitating Satchmo's voice, encouraging Jacob to join in...August is a great performe filling up the space with his impersonation. Jacob can on laugh along.

Come on Jacob! It's customary to sing for your supper! Jacob joins in to perform with August. Marlena applauds t August breaks away to dance with Marlena as Jacob sings. begin to slow dance, very intimately. Jacob gives up singing and plops himself on an upholstere chair, drinking more champagne. Jacob watches them dance: 54.
He looked like a different man when he looked at her. I said to myself, maybe love does that to a man. I didn't know much about it. Suddenly, August kisses Marlena - a bit too aggressively.
Darling. Darling, please..

Gently. We have a guest. August stares at her. His expression darkens - locking hi eyes on Marlena and tilting his head as if he is examinin her. Marlena smiles and strokes his face. August doesn't respond. He remains intense...

Darling, what is it? August takes her face by the chin and tilts it with compl control, as if searching for proof of something he can't trust. His grip tightens, hurting her. Alerted, Jacob sits up, prepared to intervene...But Marle shows no sign of fear. She knows exactly what to do.
August, dear... She manages to moves his hand to her mouth and kisses it.

You don't know your own strength, my love. And then, just as quickly, August's expression softens, relaxes, almost into sadness...as if he's about to cry....Marlena senses it immediately. She whispers loving
Auggie? August stops and eyes the bed beyond them. He leaves Marl and throws himself face first on the bed.

Excuse me, Jacob. Jacob watches as Marlena attends to August, lifting his l onto the bed, taking off his shoes. August begins snoring 55. Marlena smooths the hair out of his face then closes the curtains and returns to Jacob in the main room.
Is everything all right? Marlena puts a finger to lip and keeps it there, as she returns to her Victrola and selects another record. She cranks it on and plays it low. A RUTH ETTING SONG.
Oh yes. He's just had too much to drink, that's all. I hope you had a good time tonight. I wanted so much to make things up to you.
Tonight was your idea?

Oh Auggie wanted it too, he felt horrible about what happened. He really does like you Jacob. But it's hard for him. He's under a lot of pressure. He does more than people realize holding things together.
You said that.

Well it's true... (Opens her arms to him.) One dance before you go? Jacob cautiously approaches. Marlena takes his hands but Jacob presses closely against her and places his hand aga her bare back, he almost swoons. They slow dance. Both ti
Jankowski is Polish isn't it?
Is that all right?
Yes, of course, sorry...I just think it's interesting. I don't know what I am, besides August's wife....I grew up in foster homes since I was a baby.
Kentucky, Oklahoma, Kansas, Texas...I must have covered a dozen states by the time I was 17. I'd make up stories about who my parents were...
When I was five, I pretended for a whole year my mother was an Appaloosa mare... They both laugh.
I did! ... and I pretended that I was really an Appaloosa filly...and that I was just dreaming I was a girl and one day, I'd wake up...and I'd run home.
Anyway, I was a lot safer inside those stables than I ever was inside those homes... Marlena stops, not wanting to continue. Jacob finds a new route for her conversation.
What happened at 17?

There was a parade for the circus. At the head, there were six black Fresians, 17 hands high wearing red tassles. So proud! So beautiful. And August was leading them. The second he looked at me, the way he looked at me, I knew I'd never live with strangers again. And the way he talked. Told me "I'd find a home in every city..welcomed in every town...and he'd give me--
-- a life most suckers can't dream of"!
Ha, you too, huh?
It's a wonderful lie, isn't it?
But he said he'd make me a Star Attraction and he did. I'm pretty lucky he found me. Jacob, lost in her eyes and her voice, blurts out:
He was pretty lucky to find you. Marlena is surprised by the compliment...and endeared.
You're sweet to say so. Beat. Feeling exposed, Jacob searches to change the subje
Pretty song.
Don't tell him what happened... Jacob takes this as an intimate moment between them.
Oh no Marlena, I won't ever tell. Marlena smiles, laughs, using Jacob's joke back on him;
That's the name of the song. "Don't Tell Him What Happened To Me". Ruth Etting. She's one of my favorites. Jacob's head starts spinning. Marlena takes care of him;
Are you much of a wine drinker?
I have no idea.
Maybe you should go to bed.
Where's that? Marlena laughs. Jacob's bow tie is undone - she ties it; 58.

Here, let me...We can't let you go out there all untied. A circus is a small town. What will people say? As Marlena ties his tie, Jacob's eyes simply rest on Marlena's face - sinking deeper in love. When Marlena finishes, she looks up to Jacob...She can tell Jacob is enamoured. She smiles warmly, touching his cheek...
Sweet, sweet Jacob...
I'm not that sweet.
(Lowers her hand) Good night. Marlena turns and disappears behind the velvet curtain. J stands still for a moment, then exits.
A drunk Jacob sees the ring stock car door open, filled w people's legs hanging out and loud voices from within.

Jacob hops up into the car. Kinko is giving a party, with bottle in his hand and drunken hospitality on his face. Thirty performers cram the area usually occupied by Marle horses, including BARBARA and another Coochie girl, NELL. Kinko and Queenie are performing tricks. Jacob watches. H admires the talent and humor of Kinko and Queenie's act. the end, the girls laugh and applaud. Jacob joins in:

But the sound of Jacob's voice immediately makes Queenie and growl at him. Jacob stops. Kinko, Barbara and the Coochie girls stop laughing and st the drunken young man, with his shirt out of his pants. H ripe for the picking! They get an idea! 59.

JACOB MY FRIEND!! Folks, this is my friend and roommate Jacob. I'd like you all to make him feel at home! Kinko starts laughing uncontrollably and before Jacob can protest or escape, Barbara and Nell approach him, moving for the kill. Blurry-eyed, Jacob staggers back but the ot refuse to let him leave. In fact, he is picked up bodily, raised above their heads and transported to Silver Star's empty stall as Barbara and Nell disrobe him.

head_text.subj: IN BLACK OUT....WE HEAR A SCRAPING NOISE THEN SEE A SLIVE
LIGHT AS A LID IS OPENED.

text: Kinko opens the lid of a trunk, speaking to someone insid
Where am I? Kinko moves about a car filled with racks of costumes, pr and an open trunk containing the hidden Jacob.

Where are you right now or where are you in an Aristotelean context because right now you're in a trunk. Inside the trunk, O.S. Jacob lifts his arm to Camera and discovers he is dressed in a red silk dressing gown...
Where are my clothes? I'm not wearing anything underneath this---
Huh-huh. As Jacob struggles out of the trunk, we only see his arms
What the hell did I do last night?
You threw up on Barbara...And maybe Nell. 60.
I feel sick.
You look a little pale. Kinko holds the mirror to Jacob. We see for the first tim JACOB'S FACE HAS BEEN PAINTED AS A CLOWN.

Jacob races through each car - past musicians, clowns and Coochie Girls - clutching his robe, rubbing the make-up o Along the way, the circus company taunt and tease him wit sexy hoots and hollers. Kinko follows him, delighted.
Having cleaned up, Jacob is dressing in his own clothes. Kinko sits on his cot "reading Shakespeare" with a melanc Queenie at his side. When Jacob scratches his shaven ball
Your balls itchy?
Pissed off, Jacob continues to dress.
It'll grow back. Aw come on, you still store about last night? Now I figure we're even. In fact, I probably owe you one. Feel free to borrow a book.
Let's just drop it. Kinko opens a book to read. Jacob notices Queenie's quiet
What's wrong with Queenie?
What do you mean "wrong"? 61.
I mean she's not hating me. Something's wrong.
(Concerned, pets her) Yeah, she's been like this all day. I don't know...she must have eaten something. She did her business and it was kind of...watery.
Her stool? Did you look at it for parasites?
I don't like looking at my own.
Get some honey from the cookhouse. And if you can find any slippery elm powder. But the honey should do it. If not, we'll check her for parasites. Jacob starts to exit. As Kinko reads his book;
Jacob?
Thanks.
Sure Kinko. He moves to exit again. Kinko never looks up from book;
Jacob?
Yeah.
My real name's Walter. They never look at each other but a friendship is formed. Jacob exits. 62.
When Jacob hops out, he sees performers and roustabouts a gathered by a performer train car, huddling and discussin He crosses to investigate, meeting up with August Diamond and Mr. Erwin...
We got big trouble. Lucinda died. Now we've got no center ring star act and no sideshow star...
How did she die?
I don't know where we're gonna find a fat lady this late in the season.
I don't care where you find one, but find one. (To Diamond Joe) Better get some kind of rig set up to lift her out of the car. How did you carry Silver Star out?
In pieces.
Oh yes... (considers for a second) Mmmm...
August!
No, no, of course, don't be silly! Right. Well, figure something else out Joe but get it down for the performance. Put her in the hippo tank for now.
You better start on that elephant. We need her performing yesterday. 63.
Out of the darkness of her car, the enormous elephant emerges, being led down a ramp by Jacob.

Jacob - cleaned, dressed and hung over - sits crossed leg in front of Rosie. The two stare at each other. Rosie's n searching the ground for something to eat. Jacob, without energy or focus, his head pounding, orders her;
Rosie...Up. Rosie just looks at him without moving.
Up. Rosie. Up. Rosie's trunk starts to sniff around Jacob.
Rosie....Walk!...STEP!..Rosie STEP! Rosie's trunk investigates Jacob's body, tapping his head
Rosie please. My hair hurts. Rosie's trunk snakes around him.
No...No more Cracker Jack until you do something....Rosie!... Rosie curls her trunk around Jacob and slowly topples him sideways, turning him over as he weakly threatens;
I'm getting really mad now....I mean it...Rosie stop... Rosie gets the Cracker Jack from his back pocket...
You just can't get enough of somebody in your pants, can you? Jacob quickly gets up as August strides towards him; 64.
Heard you had a rough night?
Does everybody know what happened?
Yes.
Can somebody tell me? August suppresses a laugh.
I'm opening the midway and the menagerie this afternoon for some extra cash before the show tomorrow night. We'll see how she does with the crowd. She got any skills?
Finding food? But I don't really know how to do this.
Well, first of all, you can't do anything with a bull without the bull hook. August takes the BULL HOOK from the ground.
It's the only way to train them. Watch. Jacob steps back.
August stabs Rosie behind the shoulder..Jacob winces. Ros lifts her foot a little.
August keeps jabbing her with the hook...dotting her fles with blood. Jacob gets upset.
August, there's got to be another way. 65.
We don't have the time! She has to start earning her keep MOVE! UP!

August stabs her other shoulder...harder...continuing to shout. Rosie is getting agitated...pulling away from him constrained by her chain. Her eyes fearful. Other performers rehearsing in the area begin to watch as August strikes Rosie harder and harder. She begins to ble Jacob tries to stop August by going for the bull hook...
Please, August, let me try again. But August angrily pulls it away and turns on Jacob:
Don't tell me my business! You don't want to watch this, get the hell out! Making love to it ain't going to work. Besides, from what I hear, you're not that good at it.
Jacob watches, upset and furious at August's treatment.
Rosie's flesh is dotted with wounds from August's bull ho Jacob is applying zinc ointment to them.

I'm so sorry girl. Just a few more here. Hold still. The un-staked canvas flaps behind Rosie wave up with the breeze....Rosie's trunk rises. She smells something from outside the tent. When Jacob bends down for more ointment, Rosie tries to t around but her chain is still staked into the ground. As Jacob straightens up, he sees: Rosie's trunk carefully wrap itself around the stake and it up out of the ground....She then manages to turn herse around, her butt to Jacob. Rosie's trunk then dives down up under the canvas flaps. 66.
Rosie?

A VAT OF LEMONADE LEFT ON THE CONCESSION STAND, which is the process of being dismantled. Work men are carrying it back to the train. WE SEE: Rosie's trunk come out from under the canvas, her body hidden, searching for the lemonade. Jacob peers out to see: Rosie's trunk dip itself into the of lemonade and drink the entire contents. Jacob is amazed. He looks around: Workmen are some distan away loading the train. No one else sees her. Rosie finishes then turns back into the menagerie. INT. MENAGERIE TENT - TUXEDO PARK, NY - CONTINUOUS - DAY. Rosie's trunk gathers up the stake and then stakes it bac into the ground. Jacob can't believe his eyes. He laughs.
As the train travels to Weekhawken, New Jersey...Jacob is looking out of open car to NYC skyline across the river.
We were on our way to the Manhattan/ Jersey show and Mr. Erwin still hadn't found a fat lady. Tickets sales were low. So August, ha,ha...August pulled a hat trick.
August is sitting atop Rosie, smiling, waving his top hat then forlornly placing it against his chest and lowering head in respect for Lucinda. Manhattan is in the distance 67.

A parade like you never saw, a funeral and a celebration, saying goodbye to one star, introducing a new one...playing those rubes dying to get a peek like he was rolling a coin over his finger tips... Rosie leads a small parade of clowns, including Walter an perky, healthy Queenie down the main street. Marlena sits atop a Percheron, in full costume. Jacob walks astride. Lucinda's Wagon, carrying "the dead Lucinda", follows.

It wasn't really Lucinda in there. It was Barbara in a fat suit and wig inside the hippo den. We buried the real Lucinda by the railroad tracks between towns. Cemeteries cost too much. We were the only family she knew. People line up to cheer and offer their silent respects.. satisfy a ghoulish fascination at the "dead" fat lady.

August sure was right about Rosie. She pulled the people right in. Rosie played that crowd like a pro. The rubes love the exotic Rosie...kids run up to pet her their parents. As Rosie passes, we see AN OLD WOMAN standing in front of green shuttered house waving with delight. We see she has abundant vegetable garden which Rosie eyes covertly.
WE HEAR: The Band playing from inside the Big Top as the performers and ring stock are lined up for the Grand Spec

But as soon as the Spec started, we all knew it was too soon for Rosie's debut. Rosie heads the line. Marlena sits atop her, in her sequi and headdress, grabbing onto Rosie's leather halter. 68. August stands beside with the bull hook. His face is cold still. His fingers clutch and release the bull hook. The SPEC MUSIC begins and everyone makes last minute adjustments...Kinko and Queenie included....August shouts into Rosie's ear.

Rosie hesitates so August strikes her right shoulder with bull hook. The pain sends Rosie flying through the Big To flap, causing Marlena to adeptly flatten her back atop Ro so as not to hit her head on the pole that runs across th Big Top flap. Others gasp at the near accident. August is already furio Jacob senses danger ahead. He follows in, curling the edg the sidewall so as not to impede the Spec performers.

Jacob watches as Rosie makes it twenty feet down the hippodrome track then stops. Without missing a beat, Marlena yanks herself upright, be a smile and thrusts her hands in the air, her back arched her toes pointed - as if it were all a part of the act. The crowd goes wild - clapping, throwing peanuts, whistli Rosie only moves in fits and starts, causing the rest of Spec to pass them by at times. She trots ahead of August then when August reaches her she stops, making August hal awkwardly. August feels humiliated until: The crowd laughs, thinking it's the act. They applaud. August realizes the crowd loves it. So August, the perfor starts to play the infuriated fool to the audience, actin comically angry and frustrated with Rosie.. But when he turns back to Rosie, he is red-faced with rea anger, poking under her shoulders with the bull hook. After three stops and starts, August plunges the bull hoo sharply into her shoulder blade...and Rosie takes off at faster speed, curling her trunk in the air. The crowd che 69. Marlena grasps Rosie's halter as they fast approach the dangerous pole above the entrance. If Marlena doesn't bai she'll be knocked off by the pole. Jacob, August, the Spec and the audience watch enthralled Rosie charges toward the entrance...when suddenly: Marlena lets go of the halter and leans hard to the left. Just as Rosie bolts out of the Big Top, Marlena grabs hol the pole above the entrance and is left hanging there as Rosie exits the Big Top... For a moment, the audience doesn't know if this is part o the act. Jacob wants to run to help her... But Marlena quickly decides what to do; She lets go of th pole with her left hand and quickly swings around so she facing the audience, still hanging from the pole. Her face lights up and she points to her toes. The Band Leader takes this as a signal and conducts the band into drum roll. The crowd relaxes and applauds. Marlena begins swinging, gaining momentum as the band rol mounts. Soon, in one final burst of performance inspirati she releases herself from the pole, sails through the air tucking her body into a ball, rolling twice, uncurling fo one sideways rotation and lands firmly in the sawdust in feet. She straightens up and thrusts her arms in the air. The crowd goes wild. The Band plays victory music. Coins thrown from the bleachers. Even the Spec performers cheer August acknowledges the audience's response by bowing as it were all his creation. But after a moment, Jacob can see Marlena is in pain as s turns and subtly limps out of the Big Top. He follows her
Jacob rushes to her. Marlena, in pain, collapses in his a
Oh Jacob... August rushes out and is stopped cold by the sight of Marlena in Jacob's arms. He immediately tenses up.
August, she's hurt. August takes her in his arms. Barbara appears to help. 70.
I'm here, darling, I've got you.
Bring her to my tent, it's closer.

Jacob, send Joe for ice. You go and find that Goddamn bull before we're run out town. And take the hook! August is seething, his expression cold, as he carries Marlena O.S. Jacob, concerned, takes the hook and runs O.

Rosie is standing in a vegetable garden calmly feeding herself cabbages. The owner is the OLD WOMAN who was delighted by Rosie in the parade. She is now screaming hitting her with a small garden shovel...Jacob runs up.
I'm sorry ma'am. I'll get her.
You better before she gets at my --
Rosie has helped herself to tomatoes. Jacob steps in.
Rosie, no! Stop! Rosie pauses for a moment, flapping her ears at Jacob, th shoves a bush of tomatoes in her mouth. Jacob almost laug
Bad elephant, that's not nice. This kind lady hasn't invited you.

head_text.subj: ARE YOU CRAZY TALKING TO AN
