text: She exits into the house as Rosie wraps her trunk around cabbages, uprooting them, as Jacob tries to battle her tr Greg arrives with a bucket he places in front of Rosie. H trunk stops fighting Jacob and sniffs inside the bucket. 71.
What's in the bucket?
Gin and ginger ale. Elephants love booze. One whiff of this and she's not thinking about cabbages no more. (Bats her trunk away) ... moj malutki paczuszek?
Greg, right? Are you Polish?
Grabowski.
Jankowski. Greg again pushes Rosie's trunk away from the bucket.
Last show I worked, one bull faked a belly ache just to get the whiskey...Better grab the hook.
Are you a bull man? August would hire you in a minute.
Don't want the job. Not for him. Besides, I'm not bull man. I just like big beasts. Jacob gets it and follows Greg who carries the bucket.
Is she following? Jacob turns around to see and sure enough: Rosie is leaving the garden and trotting behind to catch to the bucket of gin and ginger ale. Jacob's impressed.

The show is still in progress - we can hear the band play for the aerialist act in the background. 72. As Jacob makes his way to Marlena's stateroom he crosses paths with August, whose face is "dark as thunder".
How's Marlena?
A little shaky. Sore wrists. Bruised heel. Doc says she'll be fine. Did you catch the bull?
She's in the menagerie.
Good. August takes the bull hook from Jacob and walks with cold blooded intent towards the menagerie. Jacob panics, reali what August about to do. Jacob follows to stop him;
August! Wait! She was good! She came back on her own! Besides, you can't do anything now! The show is still going on.
Good. The band will drown it out.

Jacob touches August's arm. August turns on Jacob with a murderous expression, shoving him to the ground. Jacob is about to get up to fight but August cautions him with the bull hook to stay down. August smiles slightly. Would he really use that bull hook on Jacob or is he kidding? Jaco stays down. August continues on, entering the menagerie t
Jacob! Jacob sees Marlena running towards him.
Jacob and Marlena run across the grounds to the menagerie workmen are running out of the menagerie tent, hearing Au screaming from inside. They enter the menagerie tent to s 73.

August is beating Rosie, who cries out with each blow. Th animals are panicking from inside their cages - the lions roaring, the monkey's squealing. Marlena freezes at the entrance as Jacob runs to August.
August turns to see her. Enraged, he stops Jacob with:
Get her out of here! NOW! Jacob wants to help Rosie but can not disobey August in t moment. He returns to Marlena and ushers her out, as Augu continues to beat Rosie.

Marlena and Jacob step away, hearing Rosie cry out. Marle can't bear it. She grabs Jacob's hand for support. Jacob tentatively holds onto her waist, guiding her away. She l into him. Jacob loves being this close to her. The screams of August O.S. pull their attention to see: Earl and his men physically dragging a maniacal August ou the tent, his bull hook and clothes bloodied by his rage. is kicking and struggling against them like a madman. Jacob is shocked by August's behavior. But Marlena has se it before. She pulls away from Jacob and exits O.S. alone

Rosie is lying on her side, her foot still chained to the stake. She is quivering, riddled with bloodied holes. Jacob is kneeling, applying zinc ointment, not knowing wh he can touch that won't hurt her. He is heart broken.

Rosie, what am I going to do with you? Rosie's eyes look up to him, her lashes blinking. Her tru lifts and wipes at her own eye. 74. Greg appears with a bucket and several bottles of whiskey begins pouring whiskey bottles into a bucket.

Here this will help. Poor beast. He really hurt her. Told you about him. (Curses August in POLISH) Don't understand why a man like that wants to be around animals in the first place. He shouldn't have the right, if you ask me. Listening to Greg, Jacob gets increasingly angry. He sees bull hook. He grabs it and marches out of the menagerie.
Earl's men are smoking, when one sees Jacob marching angr towards August's stateroom, carrying the bull hook. Alert
Somebody better find Earl.
Jacob reaches the platform to find the door ajar. He move through it. The stateroom is in a shambles. An open suitc of women's clothes lies strewn across the floor.
Marlena...! August appears from behind the curtain ; he looks uncharacteristically distraught...teary eyed and unkempt.
Do you know where Marlena is? Did she send you?
No....What happened?
She won't speak to me... He can't finish. He sits, burying his head in his hands.
...She won't let me apologize... She won't forgive me. 75. Jacob is astounded by August's sad, pitiable state.

I don't know what happens to me, Jacob. When I saw that bull running wild with Marlena, I...I lost my mind. But it's because I love her. Why can't she understand that? (Jacob stands coldly) Isn't there anyone who understands? (Jacob remains silent) Ah, it's all my fault, I know it is. I've spent too much money on that bull. I can't pay the workmen. Our debts are piling. We're losing attendance at every show. I have no Star Attraction. I don't know what's going to happen to us if Rosie doesn't sell tickets.
If I lose this circus, I'll lose Marlena - I know it. Jacob softens, seeing August in this helpless, humble lig
I'm sure that's not true.

Maybe you can talk to her. She's tired of my apologies but, this pressure I'm under...Of course, that's no excuse for what I did... (Rubs the images away) ...I can't believe what I did. Is she all right? The bull. Rosie.
She'll be OK.
Would you tell Marlena? And tell her...tell her I'll do anything. Anything she wants.
August, I can't...
I'm sure she'll forgive you...She loves you...Anyone can see that. August wants to believe him. He seems more hopeful. 76.
Thank you. My friend. Jacob nods, confused, his anger diffused. As he exits;
Jacob? Jacob stops and turns back as August asks:
What were you planning to do with that bull hook? Jacob realizes he's holding the bull hook. August smiles.
Ha. You look like me. Jacob looks in the mirror and indeed - with Rosie's blood his open shirt, bull hook in hand - he looks like a viole man.
Maybe there is someone who understands me. August smiles. But Jacob is unnerved by the smile...and t comparison. Suddenly, Earl enters and looks around, on al
What's going on?
Everything's fine, Earl. August nods to Jacob, who pushes past Earl to exit.
Jacob jumps down off the platform. Confused and disgusted takes the bull hook, wedges it under the train and breaks in half.
Jacob enters to find Greg still treating Rosie.
How's she doing? 77.
Oh she's a strong one, this one.
Jestes dobra dziewczynka Jacob watches as Rosie lifts her foot and Greg rubs ointm Jacob sees the many empty whiskey bottles.
Is she drunk?
She's four tons..she'll just sleep good. (Screwing ointment top) Potoz noge. Jacob watches as Rosie puts her foot back on the ground.

Masz, moja piekna Jacob watches as Greg digs in his pocket and pulls out a mint, brushing off the lint. Rosie's trunk investigates, nimbly plucks it out of his hand and into her mouth. SUDDENLY, JACOB HAS AN EPIPHANY.
Oh my God...
An excited Jacob is leading August to the menagerie tent.
Jacob leads August to Rosie. A curious Greg stops tending Rosie. Jacob hands August a slip of paper with Polish wor
Just read those out loud. To Rosie. August reads the words in Polish with Jacob's help...
Rosie...da--da---
Daj. 78.
Daj...daj..no-ge. Rosie does nothing. August looks to Jacob. Jacob is worri Greg suggests, in a low whisper;
Might help if he said please.
Say...Prosze Rosie daj noge.
Pros--Prozze Rosie...daj noge. Rosie lifts her foot. August's eyes gleam.
Go on.
(Reads and recites) Rosie...potoz noge. Rosie puts her foot down. August starts to understand.
(Reads and recites) Do tylu, Rosie! Do tylu! Rosie sighs, shifts her weight, then takes a couple of st backward. August is amazed. Jacob is thrilled.
That Fox Bros bull man didn't tell us was the elephant tramp who sold Rosie to them was Polish... August grabs Jacob and kisses him on the mouth.
We've got a new star! Greg remains cautious. PRE-LAP : LIVE JAZZ BAND MUSIC.

The live band plays on a raised platform. The dance floor jammed with couples. 79. Tables and U-shaped booths surround the dance floor. Tuxe bartenders serve from a wooden bar lined with hundreds of bottles in front of a smoky mirror. August, Jacob and Marlena sit in a booth. They are drunk their third bottle of champagne. Marlena is wearing a beautiful, low cut beaded red gown. Jacob can barely keep eyes off of her. Marlena is particularly drunk - we've never seen her this wild or spontaneous. She sings along with the band...she keeps rhythm by banging her hands on the table. However, she is acting distant to August. August is happy she is having a good time. When he slides next to her and puts his arm around her, Marlena stiffens
Would you like to dance, darling?
No, thank you. Awkward beat. Marlena takes her champagne glass and drink the last of it. August tries to make light of it.
We need more champagne.
I'll get it.
No, you stay with Marlena. August kisses her cheek, but Marlena is clearly still ups August lets her be. He exits O.S.
You ever going to let him off the hook?
Hook? That's an unfortunate choice of words.
Rosie's going be great. He won't hurt her again. I know it.
Jacob, what you know about August is pretty much nothing. 80. Jacob feels put down. Marlena realizes that came out too brusquely. She softens, and explains with vulnerability;

You know how many star acts we've had? How much money we've made and lost and made...? Silver Star paid for our new stateroom and look what happened to him. Everything August touches gets fed to the cats one way or another.
He'll never change. Jacob is moved. Marlena shifts gears and rises.
I want to dance.
Maybe you should wait for August.

I want to dance now! She pulls him up onto the dance floor. Marlena dances lig as air. She spins from Jacob then returns to his arms, so that her back is to him. Jacob's forearm is on her collar - skin to skin. Her chest rises and falls under his arm. hair under his chin, Jacob can smell her fragrance - then unwinds away from, like a ribbon. When the music stops, everyone applauds their dance - including Marlena. Jacob beams. He looks up to the bar: August stands stock still. His eyes glaring at Jacob. The dark expression we've come to know. Seething with quiet r Jacob takes a step back from Marlena when suddenly they h

PANDEMONIUM: Jacob is swept by a crush of bodies. People scream, shoving their way towards the exit. Marlena is sh along with them, a few heads in front of Jacob. Jacob reaches through the sea of flesh and grabs a hand. Marlena's expression, we know he has grasped her hand. Ja scans the panicked crowd for August but all he sees are strangers running in every direction, people screaming.. Jacob's hand is ripped apart from Marlena at the doorway. 81.

Jacob is thrown into the alley. People are piling into ca engines are starting, wheels squealing. Suddenly, Marlena appears, grabbing Jacob's hand. She tak off her shoes. They run through back streets.
They run under a fire escape, panting, out of breath. The sirens and screams of the crowd are distant.
Lord, that was close...Aw, look at my stockings! And they're silk too.
I wonder if August got out... Marlena looks up at Jacob and starts laughing hystericall as if for no reason. They are both still drunk.
...I don't know how we're going to get home. I've never been in New York, have you? Marlena's laughing subsides as she gets an idea.
I want to see the Empire State Building.
What...what about August?

I don't know where he is, do you? And he doesn't know where we are. It's not our fault. Like you said, who knows how long it'll take us to get back. Jacob is hesitant. Marlena takes his hand and softly plea
Just a few hours, Jacob. For just a few hours, we don't belong anywhere...we don't belong to anyone...Please. 82. Jacob looks in her eyes and knows he shouldn't, but...
I was doomed. He smiles. Marlena beams. They run off.

location: TOP OF THE EMPIRE STATE BUILDING

text: A summer storm with thunder and lightening is coming towa them from over the Hudson River. Marlena and Jacob are looking out at the expansive 1931 v of New York City. Other couples stroll about the sky deck Marlena breathes in deeply...
I've never seen so far. Have you? (Jacob shakes head) Look at it. As far as the eye can see and it's nowhere near all that's out there. Jacob notices tears in her eyes.
Are you all right?

Yes. No. Yes, hahaha I'm fine. I'm a complete mess...ha... THE THUNDER BREAKS AND THE RAIN BEGINS TO POUR... Suddenly, MARLENA SCREAMS as loud as she can, startling t other couples. Jacob laughs. Beat of silence, then:
Sorry. But Jacob understands; He screams and Marlena joins in.

The other couples leave the sky deck to get out of the ra and away from "that crazy couple". Marlena and Jacob stop, wet, panting, laughing from the release. Then, looking out at the view, not at each other 83. Marlena begins to confess what she needs Jacob to know.
Jacob? I need you to do something for me. Promise me you will.
Anything.
I want you to go. I want you get away from us, from the show. You're smart Jacob. You deserve better than us. Leave as soon as you can or something terrible's going to happen.
(surprised, confused) Why are you saying this?
It's all right. No one can hear. We'll never get another chance to say it all. Marlena looks into Jacob's eyes and finally addresses wha they're both thinking;
Nothing can ever happen with us, you know. It's too dangerous. August will never let me go. You don't know what he's capable of.
How can you be with a man you're frightened of?

I'm not. I don't have to feel afraid of him if I don't feel anything...After all these years, I've learned how to do it so well. I tell myself, "I'm managing. I can manage him. August loves me. Nobody else ever did. Who am I to say it's the wrong kind of love?" .. See, there's no place for a woman like me in any decent kind of world. You know where they found me when I was a baby? ...
...In an alley behind a whore house in Baltimore wrapped in newspaper. No one even bothered to leave a note...This circus, my horses - this is the only kind of life I can have.
August made a woman like me a star attraction...I'm lucky. And I'm safe...And I was fine - before you came. Jacob feels sorry and hopeful at the same time...
There's nothing that can cause a woman so much trouble as a good man.
I'm not that good. And I don't want to be.
Don't say that.
No, I don't. Good men don't wind up with much in the end except their goodness. Isn't worth much, is it?

See? ... Look what we've done to you already. She touches Jacob's face gently. Until this moment, they didn't realize how close they are to each other tracing Jacob's face with her hands, as he leans in closer...
Sweet Jacob.
You deserve as good a life any other girl.
Am I still a girl? I feel so old. They kiss. They stop and silently acknowledge where this going. As they move towards a secluded spot, they continu kiss in between lines; 85.
This can only be tonight. We have to go back. Promise me you understand.
I understand.
Promise me you'll suffer.
I already am.
Promise you'll look in my eyes the whole time.
I promise. Jacob kisses her with his eyes locked onto hers...With Marlena's back pressed against the entrance, Jacob reache and locks the door. They sink to the ground.
Marlena sits inside Jacob's embrace on the ferry, her hea leaning against his chest - their hands entwined.
If I had money, if I could take care of you, would we be going back?
You'd have to be a Rockefeller... August would find me. He always does.
Have you tried to get away before?
Jacob you promised. You said you understood it was only tonight.
I know. I do....I'm sorry. 86.
Jacob walks Marlena out of the port to a waiting cab. The stop a few feet from the cab. Jacob gives her all the mon in his pockets. Marlena looks at him as if for the last t

Where were you when I was 17? Jacob smiles. They kiss not wanting to let go. Marlena pu away and runs into the cab. Jacob watches it drive away. EXT. MENAGERIE TENT - WEEHAWKEN, NJ - PRE-DAWN. Jacob reaches the circus. Everyone is asleep.
Jacob enters the menagerie, heading straight for Rosie. H gets on the ground beneath her and lies down...Rosie rais her trunk to allow Jacob to lie beneath her.
Jacob is asleep under Rosie when Walter wakes him up.

Why are you sleeping here? Somebody's looking for you. INT. CANVAS CAR - WEEHAWKEN, NJ - PRE-DAWN. Jacob and Walter enter to find Bill and Grady hiding an ailing Camel in a dimly lit car. Jacob kneels down to him
Hey kid. How nice to see ya.
Hey, Camel. What's wrong?
I don't know, kid. Woke up a few days ago and my feet was all floppy. Jes can't feel'em right... 87.
...It ain't just that though. It's other stuff too.
Like down there...man stuff? Camel, his eyes wide and fearful, nods slowly.
What's wrong with him, doc?
I don't know.
Jamaica ginger paralysis. Jake leg. I've seen it before.
No such thing. Is there Doc? Walter looks at Camel's empty "Jake" bottle.
The manufacturer started putting this plasticizer in it, or something, to get around regulations that Jamaica ginger extract not be sold as booze.
You're not supposed to drink this stuff, ya know.
Well what the hell am I supposed to drink to stop the shakes? It's Prohibition and I ain't no Astor.
It's OK Camel. Tomorrow's payday. We'll get you some moonshine.
Grady don't lie to the man. If men were getting paid, Blackie wouldn't have tossed four of " em between Boonton and Weehawken.
Four?...Will he get better? 88. Walter looks at him, his expression says No.
We can't leave him here. They'll red light him for sure. Jacob understands. He gets an idea and turns to Walter. Walter understands and reacts with an adamant:
Walter is walking quickly back to the performer train. Ja follows, trying to reason with him. Throughout the scene, they are looking out for Blackie's men and speaking low.
Walter, please. Blackie and his men only patrol the roustabout cars. They don't work the performer train. We can hide him easy until-
Until when? What are we going to do with him? Shoot him like Silver Star? Because that's what he is Jacob. In a week, he won't be able to move his legs at all.
He has a son in Pennsylvania. Near Reading. We're playing there in three weeks. That's all he needs. Walter doesn't want to do this, but clearly can't say no.
I was right about you. You're going blow us all up...August got home tonight before you and Marlena. People are talking. Walter stalks off leaving Jacob unhinged by the news.
I shouldn't be a clown. I should be a Goddamn fortune teller. 89.

The cookhouse tent is divided into two sections by a curt One one side: working men and the buffet table of food. I made up of benches and bare wood tables with salt and pep shakers. The other side of the curtain is filled with performers. tables have a checkered tablecloth and flowers. Marlena is sitting alone, drinking a cup of coffee. Jacob approaches. He sits opposite her.
Good morning.
Good morning Jacob, how are you? Marlena smiles. Jacob senses others eavesdropping...but t table is far enough away, so they can't be heard.
I wanted to, uh...Is there any chance I could speak with you alone?
About what? Is something wrong?
No, I...I just wanted to...Walter said people are talking about what happened...last night...

Oh Jacob, champagne completely overwhelms my senses..I always feel the better for it when I abstain. All I remember is getting pushed by the crowd and then running and getting a hole in my stocking. I don't even know how I got home. I don't remember a thing.
Well, I want to apologize for-- 90.

Ha,ha Jacob, it's silly of you to apologize for my torn stockings. You weren't even there. Jacob is crushed by her reaction. Marlena maintains her upbeat facade. August enters with his tray of food and crosses to them. He is smiling like a man who has spent t night having great sex. August kisses Marlena right in front of Jacob. It is a lo sensual kiss...a holdover from their night together.
I slept like a baby after last night. Thank you my darling.
August, please. We're in public. Jacob understands his meaning and is quietly devastated.
Ah, nothing to be ashamed of. Man and wife reuniting in the most sacred of marriage places.
My Marlena has forgiven me. All's well with the world again, right Jacob?
That was quite an adventure last night. I'm glad I didn't have to bail you out. How did you get home?
I don't know. I just ran.
How did you two get separated? You were so close on the dance floor.
I told you, sweetheart. We got pushed apart by the crowd. This older married couple brought me to the ferry.
I'd like to look them up and invite them to the show free of charge...

...I'll even pay for their transportation. I'd pay it a hundred times over to anyone who helped my wife to safety. Thank goodness she had chaperones. If anyone had harmed her, or even touched her, there's no knowing what I might do. Jacob makes note of the implication. Marlena ignores it.
While Jacob coaches August from the sidelines, the compan performers and workmen watch August command Rosie in Poli
...August said he would create an act for Marlena and Rosie that would have'em line up for miles... August and the company are delighted when Rosie lifts her foot...or walks forward, then backward..

His accent was awful but Rosie obeyed without fail. Marlena watches, full of excitement and praise for August instructs Marlena where to stand. He commands Rosie who l Marlena up with her trunk. Everyone cheers and applauds. Those near Jacob pat him on back, grateful that he saved the circus. Jacob smiles.
I was finally a part of them.

head_text.subj: HER BACK AND WE CUT TO
MARLENA ATOP ROSIE IN FULL COSTUME MAKING THEIR ENTRANCE
PACKED HOUSE AS AUGUST LEADS THE WAY TO CHEERS AND APPLAU

text: When they enter the center ring, they stop. August gives Rosie the command to lift Marlena down with her trunk. But Rosie hesitates. August commands her again, with more force. But Rosie doesn't move forward...she shuffles a fo backwards. August grips his silver tipped cane. Oh-oh... 92. Jacob and other performers watch anxiously. Will Rosie fa Then August turns to the audience and mimes apologizing t the crowd. When he back is turned, Rosie hits his butt wi her trunk. August freezes. The crowd laughs uproariously. Jacob and the others realize it's all part of the act. Wa slaps his back. Barbara kisses his cheek. August displays great performance skills. He turns to Ros acting suspicious. Rosie lifts her head away, as if to sa "It wasn't me". August turns back to the crowd to apologize and once agai Rosie flicks his behind with her trunk. This time August knows it her. He turns to her, tips his hat over his brow shakes his finger, scolding, as if to say, "No, no, no" Rosie responds by waving her trunk, mocking him. And the crowd bursts into applause. August commands Rosie, who lifts Marlena with her trunk a places her on the ground.
Posters of ROSIE and MARLENA highlight the act COMING SOO Blackie and his men are covering up the Posters of other circuses and town events.

August could have given Barnum a run for his money. He spent the payroll money on expensive posters promoting that act like it was bigger than Ringling. And we sold out every performance in every town...

Marlena blows kisses to the audience. She skips theatrica around the ring, with Rosie trotting behind her, August hovering beside. Marlena stops and wipes her brow, feigning exhaustion, an sits on a small ball. 93. Rosie observes her with a smile and a raised trunk. Rosie copies Marlena's actions, placing her enormous rear down much larger ball. The crowd screams with laughter. Marlena stands in mock outrage, wagging her finger at Ros She turns her back on her, folding her arms. Rosie also stands and presents Marlena with her rear end facing the other way. The audience loves it.
In that center ring, Rosie became a guaranteed star attraction...
Jacob sits alone facing Rosie, in her massive stock car m of steel, talking to her, in Polish...
Alone with me, telling her every thing I couldn't tell anyone else, she became the closest thing I had to family.

Marlena looks back and scowls. With dramatic flair, she raises one foot and places it on the small ball as if to "Take that, elephant!" Rosie, not to be out done (guided by August's Polish commands) curls her trunk, lifts her foot and places it o her larger ball. Marlena straightens out both arms and extends her other l like a ballerina's, toe pointed. She place the foot along the other, so that she is now standing atop the ball. Rosie waits a moment, then lifts her other front foot ont the ball. The crowd explodes! August pretends to be outraged with Marlena. But as showers of coins and money rain upon them August and Marlena stand beneath showers of glittering co
And August! Ha, August was a new man.. 94.
The workmen set up the circus with energy and renewed spi August treating them with pats on the back of gratitude.
..treating everybody first class, spreading the word his Rosie act would finally get the men paid..
Jacob, Walter and a Camel enjoy a card game and moonshine
..And with business so strong, nobody was worried about getting tossed, so we didn't have to worry so much about old Camel.

August is filling a bucket with gin and ginger ale for Ro JACOB (V.O.). And nothing was too good for Rosie. When August found out she liked gin and ginger ale, he made sure she got both every day, treating her like some favorite child...

Marlena does a double take, then lifts up her finger as i say "I have an idea!". With a rising drum roll, she shuff her feet atop the ball, moving herself around the ring... Rosie places all four of her feet onto the larger ball an rolls herself around the ring...Marlena and Rosie go fast and faster, along with the music... THE CROWD GOES WILD....August takes Marlena's hand and ki it as they take their bows.
But I didn't trust the new August. I kept waiting for the real one to show up. 95.

Out of the darkness of the car, Rosie appears in the ligh being guided down the ramp by August, who gently pets her trunk, whispering in her ear. Her ears flapping, she purr with affection. Jacob watches.
It was when I saw Rosie purring under his touch as if nothing had happened between them, that the worst thought occurred to me.
Marlena and Jacob are laughing, listening to August telli story after a private dinner. Jacob glances at Marlena...
Maybe, I was the man not to be trusted. Marlena moves to August's lap. They kiss...Jacob watches
Marlena looked happy...And it broke my heart.
The circus is nothing without it's traditions..
August has gathered all the performers and trainers in a circle. Jacob stands in the center. Marlena beside August

..It's a family. And like any family, when a new member is born, it's arrival must be greeted with celebration and gratitude. Now, we've been a little busy with sold out performances, thank the Gods..
..but right now I want to take this moment before today's show to gather together..We close our eyes.. Everyone closes their eyes.
..and we thank whoever's up there that sends desperate men running for the rails.. Everyone laughs.

..because it was a lucky day when Jacob Jankowski jumped our train. Because of him - together with our beautiful Rosie and my beloved Marlena - we have the greatest star attraction in Benzini Brother's history. He found a way to save us all. And so, to officially welcome Jacob into the family, we open our eyes.. Everyone opens their eyes.
..And we give him the traditional Benzini Brothers baptism.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY, EVERY CLOWN PULLS OUT A SELZTER BOTTLE AND DOUS
JACOB..BARBARA AND ALL THE GIRLS THROW HALF A DOZEN PIES
HIS FACE AND BODY. OTHERS THROW CONFETTI, STREAMERS...

text: Jacob is a mess, covered in pies, seltzer and confetti. T company breaks up with laughter, applauds and cheers...Wa and Barbara bring Jacob towels, embracing and kissing him The rest of the company follows suit. August motions for Marlena, who retrieves a large mens clothing box and carries it to Jacob as August watches fr distance...The crowd parts as Marlena hands him the box. August watches Jacob open the box to find his own TUXEDO.
Now you don't have to borrow mine. Everyone applauds, hugging and kissing Jacob:
Thank you, August. 97.
It's from both of us. Jacob looks to Marlena. It is awkward between them. They can't kiss each other. Jacob nods and says courteously;
Thank you, Marlena.

You're welcome, Jacob. As Marlena exits with the others, we discover August watc from them a distance; August's expression tells us he knows what they are hidin EXT. BIG TOP - SALEM, NJ - DAY. Marlena and Rosie exits the Big Top. We hear tumultuous applause coming from inside. Jacob awaits them, as usual. Jacob commands Rosie, who lifts Marlena off his back and places her carefully on the ground. Jacob pets and comman Rosie to follow him, but stops when:
I wonder if you could help me.
Sure.
I've planned a surprise for August. He's been so wonderful, don't you think?
Could you make sure Rosie is staked in my tent after the show?
No problem.
Thank you so much...Oh, and I'm sure it would be nice for August if you were there too. Marlena turns and exits O.S. Jacob isn't sure what to thi 98.

Rosie is staked into the grass inside Marlena's tent, hap occupied with a pile of watermelons. Marlena wears a silk beaded dress with the diamond neckla There is a serving table with silver domed platters and w bottles. Marlena is trying to open a champagne bottle whe Jacob enters.

Oh, he'll be here any second. Jacob, can you open this for me? Jacob takes the champagne bottle and manipulates the cork Rosie's trunk is curious, inspecting the bottle in Jacob' hand. Jacob laughs. Marlena sees and laughs as well.
Rosie...get away....ssstop!! Rosie continues fooling around, causing Marlena and Jacob laugh even harder when the cork pops...
What is this? Jacob and Marlena turn to see August enter, laying down h hat and coat, his shirt unbuttoned at the top.
Jacob pours the champagne into two flutes, which Marlena rushes up to August, handing him a glass and kissing him.
Did you show Jacob the opening night present I gave you? Marlena turns to Jacob and indicates the diamond necklace
(indicating the necklace) Oh. No...Do you see Jacob?
Beautiful.
It looks stunning on you. 99. They kiss again. Marlena raises her glass of champagne.
To August - an authentic miracle man because he made a star attraction out of me.
To August! August nods in gratitude. They tilt their glasses and dri
Many thanks. Forgive me for arriving too soon and spoiling the surprise. August takes out a cigarette and lights it.
Don't be silly. I couldn't wait for you to come.

I could go back out to give you more time...or better yet, yell RAID and clear the place out so you two can be alone. In a split second, Jacob and Marlena know the danger pres August gave no sign of it coming.
What?
I'm sorry. I'm probably wrong. I assumed that night after the RAID was the first time you two fucked, but obviously it's been going on longer than that.
Auggie, you're being silly.
Did you think I didn't know?
August don't do this!

Shut-up. SHUT UP! 100. Marlena gets frightened. August saunters over to the silv tipped cane leaning against the flap. He picks it up as Marlena and Jacob remain still. Suddenly they hear: Rosie peeing where she is staked. She too is frightened.
How long did you think you could keep this from me?
August, please, there's nothing-
August swipes the tables with the cane, knocking all the platters and glasses to the floor.
We should go!
WE!...So you two are a couple?
NO! I just don't think you're safe to be around a woman right now.
A woman? This is not a woman. This is my wife you Ivy League lying piece of shit! Say, I bet the authorities would like to know you practise without a license.
Auggie, please... Don't you see how much I love you?

I see you. I see you too clearly. Always have. I have to admit that was a nice touch when you got back from the speakeasy. Being with me in our bed, after being with him. Covering your tracks. I should have known a whore only performs for a man like that when she wants something.
Marlena, come with me... 101.
Marlena drops the fluted glasses, crying:
Suddenly, he's quiet. He stands still. Marlena approaches now, cautiously but tenderly.

Auggie? Are you all right now?... August looks at her. Marlena's expression is one of care concern. Jacob watches carefully. Has it passed? Suddenly, August flicks his lit cigarette into Rosie's op mouth - Rosie reacts and Jacob moves to help her - as Aug grabs Marlena, shoving her so hard she falls against the table, knocking it and her to the ground. He attacks her, trying to rip off her diamond necklace. Jacob attacks August, pulling him off of Marlena. JACOB AND AUGUST FIGHT: savagely pounding each other's fa crashing against broken plates and spilled gravy, banging their heads viciously against the ground, rolling over ea other as they alternately share domination... Marlena screams for them to stop. Rosie bellows, pulling her leg chain. The FIGHT SPILLS OUT OF THE TENT INTO THE CIRCUS GROUNDS.

Jacob and August continue beating each other as they roll into the crowd. August's madness empowers him. He manages to overpower Ja in a choke hold. Jacob is losing consciousness. Because of Marlena's screams - Earl and his men run to th tent. Within seconds, they are pulling August off of Jaco August gets to his feet. His cool expression is even more frightening as he re-enters Marlena's tent.
From inside the tent, they hear a crash. Marlena screams.

No he won't, kid. Come on. Earl disperses the crowd that has gathered, which include Walter, who sees Jacob's bloodied face and goes to him. FROM INSIDE THE TENT, THEY HEAR: Two soft thuds..then a louder one...Then an unnerving silence.
See, it's over. Can we let you go? Jacob pants and nods. Earl and one of his men let Jacob g degrees, until he is standing up. Walter holds his waist.
Come on Jacob. Walk away. With Walter's help, he tears his eyes from the billowing and walks away, passing rubes who watch with fascination.
Walter uncorks a jug of moonshine and hands it to Jacob, holds a towel to his bloody, beaten face. Jacob drinks fr the jug, panting, until the pain subsides. Camel speaks f behind the trunks.
The only thing that's keeping you alive right now are the rubes who saw everything. August can't risk getting rid of you here. But you better not get back on this train when we leave tomorrow night.
What happened? Somebody turn me around. Share some of that jug!
Shut-up Camel.
Well, what the hell...! 103. Camel uses whatever strength his has to push aside the tr and see bloody Jacob.
Jesus Christ! Who did that to you?
August.

Is it true? Jacob wants to deny it but his silence speaks the truth. can only manage to shake his head NO...But Walter can rea between the lines....He lowers his head in despair. THE TRAIN STARTS TO MOVE. All three react with surprise.
Why are we moving? We have a matinee tomorrow.

Something's gone wrong. SUDDENLY, A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. The three men immediately on alert. Walter grabs his knife from beneath his pillow. Camel tries to shove himself behind the trunks. THE KNOCK COMES AGAIN as we hear:
Jacob? Jacob, it's Marlena. They breath a sigh. Jacob opens the door to reveal. Marlena with a black eye. Jacob rises to her.
I'm sorry. I had nowhere to go. I told him I'm leaving him.
My God. Are you all right?
Looks worse than it feels. (Re: Jacob's face, laughs) Ha, look at the two of us. Marlena awkwardly enters the room to Walter and Camel's stares. She sees the moonshine and breaks the ice.
Can I have a swig of that? 104. Walter throws her the moonshine. Marlena drinks like a pr
Why is the train moving? Marlena sits with the jug, casually talking:

We're being run out. Apparently, August was so optimistic about money coming in for Rosie, he figured he'd double down and find himself a new fat lady to put him really toe to toe with Ringling...So he sent Mr. Erwin into town who finds this rather large woman in a restaurant and offers her the job. Except, she...

...she was the police chief's wife. Mr. Erwin got a left hook in the jaw and we got til morning to get out of town. This cracks everybody up. Laughter. A release of tension. But the laughter turns to quiet sadness as the reality of their situation sinks in....Marlena looks to Jacob and le into his arms. He holds her, clearly in love, then ushers out of the room for privacy. Walter sees what he knew all along. He kisses Queenie:
Aw girl. We're all in it now.
Marlena and Jacob exit Walter's room outside of which Mar placed her small suitcase. They pass by Marlena's horses.
Why are you hiding that roustabout?
Because Blackie and his men don't work the performer train and they'll red-light him if they find him. He can't work anymore.
My God. 105. They come upon Silver Star's stall - empty - right before door to the next car. They stop.
Does August know where you are?
No. He thinks I'm with Barbara and the girls. He won't go there.
He can't find you. As soon as we stop - before we stop - we'll jump off and I'll take you to a hotel in town.
And after that? August has all our money. Where will I go?

Marlena, I'm not leaving you. We'll find a way together. I won't let you go back to him. I promise. Marlena smiles, needing to hear him say those words. She embraces him, grateful. Jacob holds her tight, assuring;
..I'll call my dean at Cornell..If I can take my finals again, get my degree, I can get my license. They lay in the Silver Star's empty stall. Moonlit throug the wooden slats. Making plans...

Oh Jacob, that would be wonderful. You know, I bet Ringling would take us both then - they'd be getting a vet and a star attraction - that's a sweet deal for them. Although I won't be a star but I don't care. I'll take no billing at all...We'd be safe from August if we were with Ringling.
Don't worry about him.
Of course, I'd have to wait a while until I can work again... 106.
What do you mean?
Jacob...I'm going to have a baby. Jacob is stunned...then confused...

It's yours. Please don't ask me how I know...Is it all right? You can change your mind. I'd understand. Overwhelmed, Jacob keeps kissing her. Marlena lets go of the anxiety she had about him. He loves her. She knows it
Change my mind??? Oh Marlena, please...please be happy.
(Cries, relieved) I will...I promise...as soon as I stop being terrified. Jacob kisses her. He guides her to the ground, against th hay. She nestles in his arms.
I'm so tired.
Rest...I've got you now. Marlena tries, closing her eyes.....Then, without warning

head_text.subj: OPEN STOCK CAR DOOR. THEY CHARGE INTO THE ROOM CAUSING TH
BEATING HIM. AUGUST FORCIBLY TAKES MARLENA, HITTING HER..
AS BLACKIE AND HIS MEN DRAG JACOB PAST WALTER'S MAKESHIFT
DOOR, JACOB FIGHTS EVEN HARDER TO PULL THEM AWAY FROM
BREAKING INTO WALTER AND CAMEL'S ROOM.

text: Kinko sits against the door, holding a trembling Queenie hearing the screams and struggle. Camel quivers in fear behind the trunks.

head_text.subj: AUGUST IS DRAGGING A SCREAMING MARLENA THROUGH THE DOOR T
BLACKIE BEATS JACOB WHO CRIES OUT FOR MARLENA'S SAFETY,
HOLDING ONTO THE OPEN CAR DOORS. THE MEN BANG HIS HANDS W
THEIR FISTS UNTIL JACOB LOSES HIS GRIP AND BLACK TOSSES H
JACOB ROLLS DOWN THE GRAVEL. BLACKIE AND HIS MEN JUMP OFF
TRAIN AND RUN TOWARDS HIM. JUST AS JACOB GETS TO HIS FEET
WITH A SINGLE BLOW TO THE BACK OF HIS HEAD, JACOB IS THRO

text: A heavy rain pours. A bloodied, battered Jacob is semi- conscious face down in a stream in the woods. Jacob, his eyes almost swollen shut, wakes out of unconsciousness. He looks up through blurred vision. Through the trees, he can see A DISTANT FLICKERING RED LI He stands. His knees buckle and he crawls out to the grou He stands again. And he walks out of the woods towards th flickering light. He stumbles and falls. He rises and fumbles forward...usi all his strength to get himself out of the woods.
Jacob struggles out of the woods to a clearing. Squinting through the rain with swollen eyes, he sees: 108.

head_text.subj: THE FLICKERING RED LIGHT IS A SIGNAL LIGHT ON A TRAIN TRA

text: He walks, with legs barely able to move. He climbs up the gravel to the train tracks and begins to walk...
Jacob is walking on the train tracks in the direction of Marlena's train. He has walked all night and into the day
Jacob - beaten, bloodied, exhausted - looks up ahead: THE BENZINI BROS. TRAIN and THE BIG TOP TENTS already set
It's pre-matinee. All the tents have been set up. The rub are filling the grounds. The midway is packed with people

Nell is sitting by an open window fanning herself from th heat when she sees: Jacob wandering behind the back of the train where no one see him....Nell watches as Jacob tries to reach the train then falls unconscious. Nell quickly brings Barbara to the window. Barbara sees J and immediately takes charge. Camera tracks Barbara and the girls through the windows, they walk through the car...Barbara is organizing a plan the girls.

Nell and two Coochie Girls hold their robes closed as the walk among the crowd. The Coochie girls head for Blackie his security men...They talk to them to distract them. We see Nell approach Walter in full clown make-up doing tricks with Queenie for the crowd. Nell whispers to Walte His expression tells us what we know. 109.
Barbara and the Tattooed Man sneak to the fallen Jacob wi blanket. They turn him over, shocked by his condition. Jacob's eyes open - he's delirious.
Poor Kid...Help me with him..
(delirious to Tattoo man) Don't you work the matinee?
Not today. I'm fading. I gotta re- ink.
Don't talk. Jacob nods. They cover him, pick him up and carry him off
Jacob opens his eyes. Walter is applying wet cloths to hi head. Camel watches nearby. Jacob suddenly rises;
Marlena!!
Sshh. Lie back.
Where is she? Did he hurt her?
I don't know. Your pupils are two different sizes. Jacob pushes himself up onto his elbows but his world spi
I have to get Marlena. What if he--
Jacob, look at me. You've got a concussion and you're on a moving train. There's nothing you can do. Marlena can handle him. She's done it for years... 110.
I have to get her.
Jacob, you can't.
She's going to have a baby. Walter is stopped. Camel shakes his head.
Does August know? (Jacob shakes his head) What have you done to us?
We're going to Ringling. Me, Marlena. You can too.

I'm a fifth rate clown when second rate circuses are folding all over the place. Doesn't put me on top of Ringling's list. They've got a dozen of me in the wings. I couldn't even go if I wanted to. August won't pay anyone. Says the show's debts have to come first. First time in Benzini Bros history performers haven't been paid. People are starving out there, Jacob. In the United States of America. Starving. Where am I going to go?
What about family? Like my son. Gotta have somebody...a mother.
Not a woman I have any use for. She's sold me to this outfit when I was 13.
She sold you?
I'm not exactly cut out for farm work. Don't worry about me..

..If you and Marlena go, if August doesn't kill you first - I'll know what to do...I'll tell August how well I got to know you and how I can help him find you. Might even get myself a better room out of the bargain... It won't be anything personal, you understand. Beat. Each wants the other to survive at any cost.
Do whatever you have to, Walter.
You too, Jacob. They exchange a final look, which is a goodbye. Walter tu away from Jacob, holding Queenie to his chest. Camel looks compassionately at Jacob and says:
Ya poor kid. The night this train passed ya...you shoulda kept on running, I guess.

Camel and Walter are snoring, asleep with their backs to Jacob. Queenie is asleep, nestled in Walter's arms. Jacob struggles to raise himself up. His world spins. He holds tight to the bedroll, until the spinning subsides. Jacob is a man with a mission. His eyes focus on: Walter' Knife, sticking out from beneath Walter's pillow.

The train is moving fast. The rain has returned. Jacob is making his way towards the back of the train, as moves forward. He holds the knife in his mouth...moving l a tightrope walker over the wet train roof, as rain pours When he reaches the car's end, he takes a deep breath. Wi all his strength, he leaps across the divide between the and lands, clinging to the top rail, panting like a dog. 112. He removes the knife from his mouth, having cut his lip. licks the blood back and replaces the knife, this time keeping his lips retracted.

head_text.subj: JACOB MAKES HIS WAY ACROSS SIX CARS...LEAPING FROM CAR TO
BY LANDING ON THE ROOF, GETTING TO HIS KNEES THEN TO HIS

location: ATOP MARLENA AND AUGUST'S STATEROOM CAR

text: Jacob leaps to the roof of Marlena and August's car. At t moment, the train is making a curve. Jacob climbs down over the side ladder. Beyond him, we se

head_text.subj: THE TRAIN IS TRAVERSING OVER A TRESTLE, FORTY YARDS ABOVE
BOULDERS OF A RIVERBANK ILLUMINATED BY MOONLIGHT.

text: Jacob jumps to the platform. He can see the rocky waters below the trestle. He catches his breath and waits, as th train straightens out onto land again. Jacob turns the knob of the door to the stateroom, slowly hearing a click, pausing, then opening it.

Jacob enters the stateroom, leaving the door open. He cre towards the velvet curtain which is closed. He grips the knife. When he reaches it, he pulls the edge and peeks inside. August is asleep on his side, his arms locked around Marl who is awake facing the curtain. Jacob and Marlena's eyes meet. She sees the knife in his August suddenly moves, pulls Marlena closer to his chest, burying his face in her neck. Jacob steps forward, raising the knife. His hands tremble The moonlight glints off the blade, throwing off light. Marlena is looking up at him, tears in her eyes. She subt shakes her head "NO"...She doesn't want him to do this. Jacob's hands are shaking now. The knife gripped in his h He wants to rescue her, he's so close. We hold the moment Marlena's expression convinces Jacob not to do it...not t cross that line and kill August. 113. Defeated, Jacob kneels beside her and hangs his head. Mar reaches out to touch him...this time she really is saying goodbye. But Jacob can not bear it. He looks at her for t last time, then rises and exits.
Jacob returns to the ring stock car, hopping down from th roof. The Horses are stirring, agitated. He calms them... And then Jacob sees: the door to Walter's room is open. H
Walter? Camel?
Jacob enters to find the room in a shambles. A terrible realization comes over him: Walter and Camel are gone. They have been red-lighted.
He finds Queenie, shaking with fear curled in a ball. He takes her in his arms. Jacob panics.

No..no..no..no....!!!! With Queenie, he rushes back into the ring stock car...he checks everywhere calling out their names. He stops at th open stock car door. The rain continues to fall. Jacob collapses, holding Queenie to his chest. Tears fill his e as he tries to hold it together, looking out the moving train, his worst nightmare realized.

I wanted to believe taking Walter's knife didn't make a difference. But still. I left him without a fighting chance. Maybe they survived. Maybe they were tossed over grassy land...I couldn't let myself believe what I already knew. Jacob falls apart, crying without shame. 114.
A sunny day. The circus is completely set up. Townsfolk, rubes, are already buying tickets for the matinee.
I waited almost til matinee time so I could let myself be seen by as many people from town.

Jacob opens the ring stock car and jumps out, holding Queenie. He hasn't slept all night. As he walks through the circus grounds, working men like and performers like Barbara are shocked to see him alive. With a fool's courage, he brazenly walks past Blackie and men, cutting a path through performers and working men, r up to August, who stands with Earl at his side. He is dre and ready for the matinee's performance. Jacob stops and they exchange looks. August glances at Queenie in Jacob's arms. He says nothing.
I'm not here to cause any trouble. I'm leaving.
Funny, I thought you already left.
I'd like to say goodbye. To the menagerie. Just a few minutes and then I'll go. August's eyes narrow. Earl waits for the outcome.

There's nothing more you can do to me. Killing me'll be more trouble than it's worth, now that the rubes have seen me. You were right about me from the start August, when you said I wouldn't last...I can't survive here...
I am nothing. 115. August feels victorious and therefore benevolent.

Earl, take him to the menagerie. Thirty seconds. Then escort him out of my circus, into Altoona. And if he comes back, you can shoot him, as that is within our lawful rights with regards to trespassers. August walks away. Earl escorts Jacob to the menagerie. O the way, they pass Barbara. Jacob pauses to hand Queenie her. She has tears in her eyes. Jacob continues with Earl

Jacob enters alone. He takes in all the animals who look at him. He crosses to Rosie and stands before her. Her tr greets him, stroking him. He presses his head against her Rosie comforts him. It makes Jacob fall apart all the mor After a few moments, Jacob turns and walks away. He stops the center of the menagerie. He looks at each animal in t den - in the same way as when he first met them - this ti saying goodbye. Each animal is at the front of it's den or cage, looking Jacob. There is a silent exchange between them. Earl ente
Come on kid. When Jacob starts to exit again, something happens:

head_text.subj: ALL THE ANIMALS BEGIN BANGING AGAINST THEIR CAGES AND SHA
THEIR BARS OR STOMPING THEIR FEET, SCREECHING OR ROARING
BELLOWING, AS IF IN PROTEST OF THEIR JACOB'S DEPARTURE.

text: The lock on Rex's cage busts a little as he rams against
As Earl escorts Jacob, they walk against the tide of audi members walking to the Big Top entrance. Earl speaks low.
It's good you're going. They must have known you got back on the train last night. He tossed more than half a dozen working men.
Kinkers never get tossed. Never. So that was meant for you. We hear the GOUNOD WALTZ starting in the Big Top.
A few of the guys that got tossed caught up with us again.
Walter! Is he---? Instantly, Earl's expression tells Jacob it's bad news. Jacob's breathing almost stops as he listens;

Keep walking...They got tossed off the trestle, if you can believe it. Camel's head hit the rocks. He died right away... Jacob is heartbroken and dreads what he's about to hear. pauses for a beat...this part is harder to tell:
...Walter...Walter's legs were smashed up real bad..They had to leave him.
They don't reckon he lasted the night. Jacob is in shock. He can barely walk on...
The ones that came back...Bill... Grady.. I don't know how but, one way or another they're taking down August tonight. Hearing this, Jacob stops to face Earl.
Why are you telling me? Earl can not find the words: it's clear the killing of th men does not sit well with him.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY, WE HEAR THE BIG TOP MUSIC COME TO A CRASHING HA
FOLLOWED BY AN UNGODLY COLLISION OF BRASS THAT FINISHES W

text: Earl shifts his focus - he's alarmed. 117.
Earl, what was that? All the performers and work men on the midway are on aler

head_text.subj: WE HEAR THE BIG TOP BAND START PLAYING AGAIN...THIS TIME

text: Oh Christ! Oh Shit... Earl runs back towards the Big Top.
What is it?
The Disaster March! Everyone with the show barrels towards the Big Top when G appears amongst them and calls to Jacob:

head_text.subj: BENEATH HIS FEET...THE SOUNDS OF HOOVES ON HARD DIRT.

text: Jacob shoots through the tent flap and is immediately flu up against the sidewall as:

head_text.subj: THE YAK THUNDERS PAST HIM, HIS HORN INCHES FROM JACOB, TH

text: HYENA ON HIS BACK. Jacob looks to the menagerie and faces

head_text.subj: LION, GIRAFFE, CAMEL AND HORSES... RUN IN A MAD TERROR AS
THEY SCREECH, SCREAM, SWING, WHINY AND ROAR...
MAKING CONTACT WITH THE LLAMA, KNOCKING IT FLAT.

text: Jacob is scanning the tent for Marlena when:

head_text.subj: AND CLUTCHES ONTO JACOB'S LEG. JACOB MOVES TO PICK HER UP
WHEN BOBO SWINGS FROM A ROPE AND JUMPS ONTO JACOB'S BACK.

text: Jacob manages to hold Bobo in one arm and the Orangutan i the other as his eyes sweep the tent, searching for Marle Then Jacob sees - THE PANTHER MAKES IT'S WAY THROUGH THE CONNECTED WALKWAY TO THE BIG TOP AUDIENCE.

head_text.subj: CROWD EXPLODES THROUGH THE BIG TOP, TRAMPLING OVER FELLOW
AUDIENCE MEMBERS...THEY CHARGE INTO THE MENAGERIE ONLY TO
WITH THE CHIMPS AND ORANGUTANS..A HYENA SHOULDER TO SHOUL
WITH A TIGER...TWELVE HORSES AND A GIRAFFE WITH A SPIDER
MONKEY ON IT'S NECK...THE POLAR BEAR NOW ON ALL FOURS,
CHARGING...ALL OF THEM HEADING FOR THE CROWD OF PEOPLE...
THE ENTRANCE...PEOPLE BANGING ON THE BACKS OF THOSE IN FR

head_text.ToD: - THE CLOG BURSTS. PEOPLE AND ANIMALS FLEE IN EVERY

text: Searching and dodging animals, Jacob sees a flash of pink sequins. He sees August with Marlena standing beside him, front of Rosie.

Marlena sees Jacob and makes a run for him, but August quickly grabs her arm and flings her to the ground. She f out of view from Jacob. Jacob runs to them, dodging the fleeing animals, when suddenly: A BULL HOOK FLIES FROM OUT OF THE AIR ACROSS TH ANIMALS AND PIERCES JACOB'S SHOULDER. He cries out. Rosie cries out. She begins to stamp her feet. Marlena li with her face in the dirt, crawling beneath the ropes to under Rosie for safety. 119. August pulls Jacob with a new bull hook, tossing him the ground. August glares at him, his eyes full of rage;

He attacks but Jacob dodges the next blow, grabbing onto bull hook and twisting it with such strength, it topples August who refuses to let it go... JACOB AND AUGUST FIGHT SAVAGELY, AMIDST THE STAMPEDE. Lik madmen fighting with the intention to kill. Jacob unleashes a rage and a strength we have yet to see him, as he beats August without mercy... But August manages to overpower Jacob, unleashing his own maniacal fury. By taking advantage of the bull hook wound August gets Jacob into a death grip around his neck. Marlena screams out, unable to help as animals stampede around the two men locked in combat. Only Rosie, who towers above them, knows what to do. Jacob, choking under August's grip, looks up at Rosie. Sh raises her trunk to smile at him. Jacob looks down and se that ROSIE'S STAKE HAS BEEN PULLED OUT OF THE GROUND. Jacob fights August to breathe as Rosie reveals she is holding the stake loosely, resting it's end on the dirt. chain still attached to her foot. Jacob flips himself which forces August to turn his back Rosie in order to keep his grip on Jacob. Marlena covers her head in her arms, not wanting to see. Jacob can not breathe..August is squeezing the life from

Rosie lifts the stake as if it weighs nothing and brings down onto August, splitting his head in one clean move. S continues to hold the stake until August topples forward, dead, his skull opened like a hardboiled egg.. Released of August, Jacob rolls himself under the ropes j

head_text.subj: A HERD OF ZEBRAS RUN PAST, CRUSHING AUGUST BENEATH THEM.

text: Rosie then slides the stake back to the ground. Marlena, hidden under her arms, sees nothing. The menagerie is cle of the stampeding animals. Marlena lifts her head up from beneath her arms, remainin under Rosie. She sees August lifeless body. She looks to Jacob. He rises, bloodied and beaten, but alive. WIDE ANGLE: The empty menagerie except for: Jacob standin Marlena under Rosie and the two monkeys inspecting August dead body.
The polar bear is walking calmly down main street.
It took days to round them up. Some we never did get back.
Two Children are delighted that a GIRAFFE is eating from their second story window.
Camera discovers a DISHWASHER and REX THE LION, both quivering, huddled opposite each under beneath a sink.
I don't know who was more scared - the rubes or the animals.
THE NESCI BROS. CIRCUS TRAIN is pulling up alongside the "ghost town" of the Benzini Bros - the ruins of the circu are highlighted by strong winds blowing up dust and dirt.

When the Nesci Bros. Circus showed, we were officially belly up. A MAN SCREAMS after unrolling a canvas and making a disco inside. A crowd forms. When Jacob reaches it, he sees: BLACKIE, DEAD, WITH A MAKESHIFT GARROTTE AROUND HIS NECK. 121.
DICK NESCI and the Sheriff fight with Jacob over Rosie...
...These animals are now the property of Altoona and we're here to sell them to Mr. Nesci.
Not all of them! Some of these animals are mine, like this bull.
Do you have any proof? Jacob is stalled. Greg appears.
He's right. He's just an elephant tramp. The bull is his.
You don't want her anyway. She can't do anything. Dumb as a box of peanut shells. Skeptical, Dick Nesci steps up to Rosie.
What's her name?
Gertrude. Jacob and Rosie exchange eye contact. Nesci is skeptical.

Gertrude! Gertrude, step up! UP! Rosie blows and swings her trunk, throwing dirt across th people around her. Dick Nesci takes the bull hook and prods under her leg, ordering her UP! Rosie just swings her ears and sniffs Di Nesci with her trunk. Then checks his pockets for treats. Jacob exchanges a look with Rosie. 122. EXT. CIRCUS GROUNDS - ALTOONA, PA - LATER - DAY. Jacob is walking Rosie, holding the Orangutan, with Bobo atop Rosie. Through the wind and dust, they look for Marl

head_text.subj: FROM OUT OF A WALL OF WIND BLOWN DUST APPEARS MARLENA AND

text: OF HER BLACK AND WHITE HORSES. Marlena looks spent - shoc relieved, tearful, hopeful. She reaches Jacob.
What happens now?
I wish I knew. Marlena exhausted, eases into Jacob's arms. It's over. WIDE ANGLE: Jacob and Marlena and their animals, as the g tent of the Benzini Bros. Big Top falls to the ground.
Jacob is finishing his story. Charlie is enthralled. The first bottle of scotch is gone. The second half full.

I convinced my dean to let me take my finals. Marlena was right. With my degree, our animals and Marlena's acts, Ringling got a sweet deal. Our son was born our first season. We named him Walter. He spent the first seven years of his life with Ringling.
That's why I...I just can't understand how he forgot to show up today. (His eyes glitter
There was a circus in town. Charlie understands. He looks affectionately at Jacob.
By the time our third son came, we'd had enough. Rosie was tired. (Charlie smiles. ) Luckily, the vet at the Albany Zoo dropped dead, so I got the job.

We bought some property so we could keep the horses...Rosie...then five kids...Bobo and that Orangutan...Never named that Orangutan. Nothing ever sounded.. elegant enough for her. Just called her Ma'am. (Smiles with great joy) Man oh man that was...that was a life, boy, I'll tell ya... Charlie smiles, appreciating this old man's big life.
And then before you know it, the kids are borrowing the car and moving out. Marlena and I on our own again...until she passed. This moment causes Jacob to pause. He still loves her.

I never told Marlena it was Rosie who got August. I didn't want her to know. When Rosie passed on, she cried for days. I owe that bull my whole life...my kids, everything.. A KNOCK. Charlie peeks through the window and sees a COP:
It's the heat.
They're here for me. Charlie and Jacob exchange a look. Charlie understands.
Charlie opens the door to greet a LOCAL COP.
Hi Officer, can I help you?
Yes, I'm hoping you can. An elderly gentleman went missing from the nursing home down the street. Staff seems to think he came here. 124.
We had a lot of folks from the home today. But no, I haven't seen him. The Cop peers past Charlie and sees Jacob.
Excuse me, but who is that?
(Pause, then) Oh....that's my Dad. The Cop is suspicious. Charlie covers:

He can't talk. Had a major stroke a few years back. But he's doing well. Ain't ya Pop? Understanding the ruse, Jacob starts to play the part of stroke victim: he opens his mouth, his jaw quivers. He reaches for his glass with a shaking arm. Charlie helps h Jacob holds out his tongue like a parrot's as Charlie hel him drink. The Cop watches with a blank expression. Jacob swallows and nods speechless, smiles and manages to drool Beat. The Cop wonders. Then, pulling out his card:
OK, well, thanks for your time. Here's my number in case you hear of anything. Sorry to bother you. The Cop exits. Charlie returns to sit opposite Jacob. The consider this unspoken proposal:
You sure about this? Beat as Charlie pours another shot. Then:
I wonder if we can get you into the book of records. "Oldest man who ever ran away with the circus".
Nah, I'm not running away. Just coming home. 125.

Old Jacob uses his walker to enter the menagerie. He move each animal meeting his eyes with theirs. Each animal giv him a look of acknowledgment. He comes to an ORANGUTAN...younger than the one from his Benzini days. Jacob stops. He steadies himself. Jacob lets go of the walker and reaches his arm out to th Orangutan's cage. The Orangutan studies him for a moment. Judging. Jacob keeps his arm extended, which isn't easy for him. The Orangutan then extends his hand through the bars to Jacob's hand. Jacob's fingers entwine around the Orangutan's hand. They hold for a moment. Jacob smiles.
Thank you, Ma'am.
